11.content:
Welcome to the normal section, for those of you who want to stay away from all the nutty stuff. Don't think that means you can't get a little down, though.

Pick a story, any story. Once one gets started, I'll change the name to something more descriptive.
11.title: Normal Stories

111.content:
Tyler was just a normal human fifteen year old boy from New Jersey, thank you very much. After his folks died he was left in the custody of his grandpa, but he didn't give a damn about Tyler's existence. After about a year of country living (he originally hated it) he gotten used to it. However, all his life he never had someone to call a friend.

It is June 7th, the first day of summer vacation and his sixteenth birthday. Tyler knew his kin didn't get him anything but he didn't care. So the least Tyler could do is try to find a job somewhere. Here his life turns upside-down.

As Tyler walked down the wooded driveway of his grandpa's property, a hooded figure jumped out of woods and knocked him to the ground. The figure then grabbed Tyler's bag and ran off into the woods. Acting on instinct, Tyler got to his feet and pursued the thief.

He chased the thief deep into the woods. Then somewhere in the heart of it, the bandit jumped into a tree big enough for two people to fit inside. Tyler followed. But then something happened, he was falling into a deep hole, not just that but it was just like Alice in Wonderland. Instead of a tall room like in the story, there were strange lights all around him.

Then finally he softly landed on some kind of plant. Around him he was in some kind of cave, but ahead of him was daylight. Tyler then approched the light thus leaving the cave. Upon exiting, he sarcastically said to himself, "Looks like we're not in Kansas anymore."

He walked out into a clearing in an unfamillar wooded area. There are mountains in the backround as well, but there are no mountains in Jersey. And there is a clear water river in his sights. Thats strange because he lived nowhere near a river.

Along the river Tyler noticed that there are fresh footprints on the ground, possibly the thief. They appear to be heading downstream so Tyler followed them. Eventually he spots a village that suggests that he is in a different part of the world at a different era. How the buildings were built suggests he is in...
111.title: Down the Rabbit Hole

choices: turned his head and yelled, "DADDY! A DEMON!"

"Okay, now I'm confused," Tyler says to himself. The village in his sights suggests he is in the fuedal age of Japan. But now isn't the time for questions, he still has a thief to track down.

The footprints continued towards the direction of the village. So he continued to follow them. He then caught sight of something strange.

What Tyler saw right before his eyes looked like... a pokemon? It's an eevee, well almost, a human like eevee it is standing upright. It is dresseed in a kimono just like the people in old Japan, except that it has a small hole in the back to allow the tail to stick out. And it appears to be humming a song while playing with a ball. Appently a child.

Tyler then approched the eevee kid. Just maybee, since it's humming, could it talk? Tyler had to reason with himself on one thought. Since he's in fuedal Japan, there could be a language barrier between him and the child.

Just then the ball the child was playing with landed next to Tyler's feet. The kid was laughing when it chased it's ball but came to a dead stop and gasped when it saw Tyler.

Tyler tried to think of something to say to the kid. Tyler then said to the the eevee, "Uhh, could you help me?"

The kid then...

Tyler then looked ahead and saw someone coming his way. It's a morphic espeon, most like likly this kid's father. He's coming rather fast at that, AND HE'S ARMED WITH A BOW!

He then see's Tyler and pulled an arrow from his quiver. At that moment, Tyler imedetly knew what to do next, RUN FOR COVER! Thinking fast he...

111112.title: Dead stop

1111121.content:
When Tyler looked up, he saw the Espeon looking into the river at him, pointing a crossbow at his head.
"Put you hands up Demon", he ordered. Tyler complied, and noticed that the arrow head made a deep gash in his left arm.
"You're coming with us", he said, and Tyler noticed more morphs standing behind and around him. A Vaporeon who appears to be his wife who looks pregnant, and 3 Eevees. The one called Seto, and one slightly larger and and another smaller than him. They appear to be a family. Just then, the Espeon put a bag over his head, and 2 pairs of hands grabbed Tyler, and carried him off.

The next thing Tyler knew, he was tied to a chair in an underground room. The only light was from a candle on a table infront of him. The eon and Eevee morphs were standing at the opposite side of the table. The Espeon was pacing back and forth, thinking. Despite the fact that he was pink, he didn't half look menacing: he hadn't dispensed of his crossbow.
"What were you trying to do to my son", he asked, startling Tyler.
"Nothing", said Tyler.
"Well, why are you here then, Demon?", he asked again.
"Why are you calling me a Demon, haven't you ever seen a human?", asked Tyler.
"Yes I have", he replied. His children looked absolutely terrified.
"Well, what is it then, do I not look like one", asked Tyler.
"They died out the year Seto was born", he said. Tyler was shocked.
"What are you going to do to me?", he asked.
1111121.title: A Demon?

choices: Have a look around", asked Tyler
Have something to eat", asked Tyler
11111211.content:
"What do you mean they died out, where I come from there are 6.5 billion of them", asked Tyler.
"They all killed each other, trying to prove who was dominant, we survived because we are all equal", replied the Espeon, smugly.
"Daddy, I found this in the woods near the Demon", piped up the smallest Eevee, holding out Tyler's bag.
"Hey, that's my bag", shouted Tyler.
"Your bag, why would a Demon need a bag?", wondered the Espeon aloud.
"For the last time, I'm not a Demon, I'm a human! This has gone beyond the joke now", shouted Tyler indignant.
"I have a question for you children", said the Espeon turning around."Which is faster, a *human*, or a crossbow bolt", he said, taking aim at Tyler.
"Wait, before you kill me, I have got a present for you all", pleaded Tyler, remembering that he had several begs of Murray Mints in the bag."Just untie my arms and I'll give you them".
"How do I know that you aren't trying to poison us", asked the Vaporeon.
"How about this: If you like my present, can I stay with you until I can get home, If you don't, you can shoot me with that crossbow", said Tyler.
"Deal", said the Espeon, untying Tylers arms.
"Thank you", said Tyler,"here you are", handing over the candies.
"What do we do with these", asked Seto.
"Eat them", he replied.
It takes a few seconds, but smiles appear on the morphs' faces.
"OK human, you may stay", said the Vaporeon, untying the rest of Tylers limbs.
"Can I
11111211.title: Why I am here

Yes I'm a human My name is Tyler and I"m 16 years old.
How old are you? and what are you? What is this place? said Tyler with a little fear in his voice. He often run off at the mouth when he was fearful and unsure, Which he was.

I'm an eevie, and I'm only 100 years old, this is Japan in the ancient days. When you jumped in the tree hole you jumped back in time and traveled the long distance between New Jersey and Japan. I speak many languages one is English the other Japaneese and also eevieneese. answered the little eevie.

wow you are 100 that is really old... man.

Oh it is not very old at all, I am still in my youth. It is equall to you being three.

Yes a hooded character ran passed me just moments before you arrived. he headed north. to the kingdom of dragons. But if you choose to go after him I warn you to be careful for they are a fierce lot indeed.They breathe fire through their nostrils.


Thank you for your help little one, I shall not forget your kindness, but I will follow him into the kingdom of dragons until I get back what is rightfullly mine, I will teach him that it is wrong to steal.

He was terribly frightened by the creature, yet he knew he must fight it some how in order to get passed it. John gave back the property of Tyler's and apologized to Tyler.

1112.title: Midevil Europe

112.content:
Sam Tyler was a new addition to the Greater Manchester Police Service. He may have been new on the job, but he knew every trick in the book. But nothing he knew could have prepared him for what happened on the 8th of March, 2006.

Sam was chasing a mugger in his astra, when the criminal stopped his car and leapt out, running accross peoples' gardens. Sam stopped his car and got out, but just as he began to run after the guy, an old lady in her car mowed him down, and his head smashed into the tarmac, knocking him out.

When he awoke, he was on a bench in a park. Something wasn't right. He knew where he was though, and started to walk back to his flat, it looked to be 6pm. When he saw someone walk past him, he was stunned.

It was an anthro pokemon, a Pichu by the look of it. He was shaken, couldn't think straight. He thought it was a guy in a suit, until he saw the date on the front of a newsagent. 8th March, 1973.

He entered the shop, desperate to disperse his fears, but they were confirmed when he saw the clerk, a burly Pidgeott morph.
"Excuse me, is that date correct?", asked Sam.
"Yes it is, Officer", replied the Pidgeott.
"Why are you wearing that mask, sir?" asked Sam.
"Look, little Eevee. You may be the Fuzz, but I won't tolerate wisecracks, now buy something, or get out", he said, returning to his paper.

Little Eevee? Sam knew that he was 5' 8" and slightly built, but...

Sam ran to the glass windows and stared at his reflection, what he saw nearly knocked him out again.

An Eevee in a 70's police uniform stared back at him. Brown fur covered his face and arms. His hat had holes for his ears, allowing them to stick out. As he turned to leave the shop, still in shock, he saw something new. A large bushy tail was sticking out through a hole in his trousers.

Sam had to get to the station, he had to find out what had happened
112.title: My name is DCI Sam Tyler

1121.content:
Sam burst out the shop, and started running to the police station where he worked. All around him, people stared. Well they didi have a reason, he looked like he'd nicked something.

When he arrived at the station, it wasn't the modern glass building he was used to. It was now an old Victorian building of orange brick. He entered the brown doors and saw that it was one large office on the ground floor. All around were pokemorphs, working at desks, but there were no computers.

"Ah, you must be Sam Tyler", said a voice behind Sam, and he span around. A large, muscular Arcanine morph striding towards him, him hand outstretched.
"I see what they meant when they said you were young, I'm Gene Hunt by the way, your new partner", he continued.

"Hold on a minute Gene", Sam began
1121.title: Gene Hunt

11211.content:
"I'm from the future, and I'm not an Eevee", explained Sam.
"Very funny, little guy, come on, our shift starts in five minutes", said Gene ignoring him.
"But Gene-"
"Yes?", said Gene. Sam thought that he might as well blend in, before finding a way back.
"Where's our beat?", asked Sam.
"Just around Gorton", he replied.
And the chalk and cheese pair strode out the door, into a waiting Cortina 1600.
11211.title: I, am from the future

choices: Let another officer deal with it.
112111.content:
Sam and Gene stepped into the stylish classic car and put his seat belt on as he sat in the passenger seat. The car made a rumble as the key was put into the ignition, turned to the start position, and the engine started. Gene looked over at Sam, who had been looking out the window in deep thought.

'How did I end up in this time? How am I an Eevee? Why is everyone a Pokemorph? What is going on anymore?' Is what had been running through his mind as he looked out the window to see the car finally start moving as Gene drove. What was also the top thing running on? How was going to return to his time, the last thing he remembers is being mowed down by some car and the rest was history.

He looked over at his hands again, so foreign to adorn such paws for hands. His thoughts were soon popped like a bubble as Gene tapped him on the shoulder.

"So is this going to be an awkward car ride or are you actually going to talk to me?" He says as he continued, driving after a red light turned green.

"Oh um- Sorry I am just thinking about a lot of stuff right now." Sam replies, and Gene chuckles.

"Ah, classic newbie. Come on everything will be fine Sam, you don't have to worry about anything."

"Yeah I hope." Still worried obviously, what if he was stuck here! Stuck as an Eevee police officer! Well there was nothing wrong with that considering no one treated him as if he was different, though this was no normal everyday thing. It's either that or he's dreaming. Though he could feel his fur and it didn't seem like it could be faked and Gorton was still a place in Manchester so he never really left Manchester but streets he passed by seemed different. There were Pokemon Gyms where Pokemorphs could battle it out to either resolve anger, enter into championships or even just practice to raise experience and evolve. Street violence was probably not allowed but it seems those were the places to take a fight if you wanted one. Another weird thing he saw a was PokeCenter. Just a hospital but for PokeMorphs is what it seemed like.

As Sam had been observing the places he saw a car speed down the road going about 60 on a normal road.
Gene blinked as he looked at Sam and asked, "Shall we?"
112111.title: On the Beat

choices: Fight back against the two policeman
1121111.content:
"We must at least try and check what is the occasion. But I doubt they are trying to get into a hospital, or they already would have stopped on the last 2 blocks." Gene says and accelerate the car. "Thank you, God. This won't be such an awkward car ride."

The car chase then started. The other car, as a response of noticing the police car approaching, picked up even more speed. The road was empty, fortunately, so there wasn't much risk of accident. Better yet was that the engine of the chased car actually overheated and broke, forcing the car to stop.

"Lucky?" Sam asks as Gene stops right behind the broken car.

"Yes. Much easier than I thought." The larger policeman says and leave the car.

Sam soon follows and tries to grab his gun, just to find out he was not carrying a gun at all. He started hoping things won't go very bad and if it does, then that it won't have any gun involved. Gene is a big guy who seems to be able to throw a strong punch.

"Nonononono..." Murmured repetitively the driver of the car in a very nervous way. The said driver was a Haunter pokemorph with a small criminal record, all of them were about use of drugs. Gene knocks on the windows lightly, drawing the attention of the scared drugged Haunter.

"I recommend you to leave this car and come with us without much struggle. What do you say?" Gene asks while Sam just watches behind him.

The Haunter decided to (...)
1121111.title: After That Car!

choices: Sam enters one of the PokeCenters, still feeling off from the fight earlier.
Sam decides to check out one of the gyms to see everything they have to offer.
Sam decides to just stroll around town and see other new places.
11211112.content:
The Haunter had his hands on the steering wheel before opening the door. He seemed ready to comply as he stepped out as Gene took out his handcuffs and stepped towards him. Though as he stepped towards the Haunter he felt the sudden sharp pain between his legs, being kicked extremely hard by the Haunter as he started to run and make his daring escape.
Gene almost lost balance but proceeded to take painful chase as Sam took the lead in front to catch that Haunter.

Man now this was the life, going to catch a speeder who tried to take their daring escape. This was always his favorite part of the job considering he gets to chase and catch someone trying to resist arrest. Though reality and differences crashed down on him as he was struck and splattered with some kind of.. icky purple sludge? Ew! What the hell was this and gah! He now knew what he could call pain! Ergh! He gets up after tumbling down from the sudden attack.How would he retaliate like they did? Hm... Oh if he can't think of any moves he could always do something.... regretful. Well it was a ghost maybe not. He sped up and was soon right behind him before pouncing onto him and biting him.

The Haunter started to yell with pain from the Super Effective move and stopped struggling. Sam reached for the cuffs he had on his side and handcuffed the Haunter. He the stood back up and revolted at that bite, weirdest thing he's ever done for sure. He then took the Haunter by forcefully pulling him up by the arm and taking him to the car.

"My my, you're better than I thought Sam. It's like you've done this kind of work before hahaha!" Gene says with a heart laugh and smile as Sam pushed the Haunter into the back seat of the car.

Sam was about to retort with yes he had but maybe he shouldn't. "Ah nothing to it, just beginner's luck for me. Haha."

"Heheh, sure enough. Let's take him down the precinct come back and do our normal stroll around town. Sounds good?"

"Yep, sounds good to me." They get into the car and drive down to the precinct again before dropping off the Haunter there and more miscellaneous stuff.

Soon they get on with their job back at Gorton and now Sam had some free time to walk around and see all the new places and observe stuff while still on patrol.

What shall Sam do?
11211112.title: Let's Get Ready to Rumble!

112111123.content:
Sam started walking, looking at his surroundings while trying to don't act strange to the people who lives in this weird version of Manchester, actually failing miserably on this last one.

Weird version...

Sam must also admit that he acted strangely back when Gene and he chased the weird purple man. In the middle of that heart pounding moment, he actually came to bite the drugged man.

This place... Not only did it affect his body, but his mind as well.

"What is this place?" He asks himself while looking up at the buildings nearby. All of the where so... antique. Leaving a true feeling of the 70'.

Sam felt really out of place in there and it distracted him from looking forward and notice a woman waiting for a taxi right in front of him.


"Can't you see where you are walking to?" An angry voice could be heard right after Sam bumped onto her side. He looks up at her.

She was some kind of blue... Whatever the people here are, with some kind of bunny ears on her head and had scales instead of skin... or fur, or feather, or gas based on his previous experiences in the last couple of hours. She was rather voluptuous, that is for sure.

"Pardon, Miss. I was just..."

"Oh! So you are a cop!" She interrupts him. "Quite a little too small and young to be one. Have we come to this point of despair for the police to recruit anyone?" She murmured the last part to herself.

"... Excuse me?" Sam asks. Sure, he has notice that he lost some inches, yet the rest of what happened was what really caught most of his attention and worries. But... young? Sam actually is on his early 40, with over 18 years of serving the police... Or was he? Now Sam know how it feels to discover his body for the second time. 'I think Gene said I was the new guy. How old am I?'

"... Even worst is that you are an Eevee. Why haven't you evolved yet?"

"Evolved?"

"Do you even know an efficient Move?"

"Move? Like attack?"

"Why are you aski- Kind off."

"I... I was yellow belt on karate back when I was a kid..."

"..." The Nidoqueen looks at him confused for a moment then back to the road, seeing a taxi coming. "Forget about it. Just be happy that you haven't accidentally got poisoned bumping on me."

"Poisoned?" Sam asks as the woman went inside the car. He watches the car until it turned to the right and got off his view. "What just happened?"

Only two things were sure to Sam now. This place is extremely strange and the said poison of the woman can't be as venomous as her own words.

He then starts pondering what to do now.
112111123.title: Venomous words

113.content:
You're on a road trip with your 4 friends, Adam, Carl, Gordon and Bob. It's gap year, and you've decided to travel around Europe. Unfortunately, you're still lost looking for Folkestone.

"Right, it's been 10 miles, I'm turning round", you say to your friends, as you swing around on the road. Just as you do so, a strange light envelopes the car. It lingers for a minute, before disappearing.

The landscape looks different, you appear to be in
113.title: Road to Nowhere

choices: No, you have to go down the alleyway! It's the only way to make it on time!
No way man. There's something creepy in there and I know it.
114.content:
You begin to worry as you keep nervously glancing at your watch.
Holding your shiny black camera in your hand, you rush through a local park, and dash across the street.

You see, you're about to be late for an appointment. You recently moved to the city of New York, and you have an interview to be an assistant photographer.
As a 16 year old boy, you don't have a car yet. This is the best job around, and you can't afford to miss it.

That is, not if you don't want to earn the money for one of those brand new Playstation fives..............
Quickly, you turn the corner and jab the walk button on a traffic light impatiently. You'll never make it to the interview at this rate!

You start to think angrily to yourself. How come your alarm clock had to be broken this morning? Seriously, it's the year 2019............ you'd think that technology would be better by now for alarm clocks.

You then sigh to yourself. Who are you kidding? Who cares about alarm clocks? Suddenly, a horn snaps you out of your train of thought.
"Move it kid!" a driver calls impatiently. "Are you gonna cross the street or not?!"

You shake your head, and scold yourself as you scury across the street. How come you always seemed to do that? Every time something important was happening, you somehow always found yourself daydreaming. Anyway, no time to worry about that now. Only 15 minutes till the appointment, and you still had a couple of blcks to go.

Suddenly, you see a thin space between two buildings. Perfect! A shortcut! You'll be on time for sure now!
As you approach this alleyway, you notice it seems kind of dark.............. and spooky. Maybe you shouldn't go down the alleyway..............?
114.title: Story 4

choices: speed up and run like hell! This place is gonna eat you alive if you don't!
slow down and relax. it's just abunch of garbage, and the interviewrequires calm
wait, is that a door right there?
1141.content:
You glance around quickly. Is this really the best way?
You take another look at the alleyway, and sigh. It is the ONLY way.

Naturally you want to move slowly and cautiously, but you know you shouldn't. If you do, going through this place will be in vain.
So, against your will, you pick up the pace and plunge into the dark alley.

As you skitter by, you see all sorts of things that disgust you. There are rotting cow bones, dirty ashes, old cobwebs, and black lumps of who-knows-what lining the incredibly thin gap between the buildings. And worst of all, there was a certain sort of evil, dark aura in the air that makes every single crack and shadow look like something straight out of a horror movie.

You begin to lose your cool and sweat forms around your brow. How long have you been in here? How long will it take to get out? What kind of of awful place is this? Is this even human-made? Quickly, you shake your head and take a breather. You just need to calm down and walk a little slower through this nightmare of an alleyway, or you'll lose your cool and never make it to your interview on time......................................right?
1141.title: No, you have to go down the alleyway! It's ...

choices: Run back where you came from, it's less scary, and ashorter distance
Just dash through the alleyway and get it over with!
11411.content:
You feel your heartrate begin to increase, and sweat starts to form all over your body.
You've gotta get outta here!
11411.title: speed up and run like hell! This place is gonna...

114112.content:
You take a look at both ends of the alleyway, and then make your decision.
You didn't come in here for nothing!

Madly, you dash down the alleyway, knocking down trash cans and kicking lots of waste around. You've gotta make it to the end! You've just gotta!
Sweat starts forming in all sorts of places, and you keep on trucking trough. Where was the end of this stupid alleyway!?

You keep on going, and you feel like your about to die of exauhstion. You just can't seem to reach the exit!
Suddenly, you trip. You fall over on a bone or something, and you just land flat on your face.

You lay there in a daze, and try to get control of your short and gasping breaths. 'no.....................' you moan to yourself. "NOOOOOO!!"
You just lay there with no sense of direction from all of that spinning, and your body aches, probably from banging the concrete so bad.

You give out a little whimper, and curl up. Why did you ever think fleeing down this alleyway would do any good? If only you'd known..................
The darkness in the alleyway seems like a thick wall that's slowly suffocating you to death. You're terrified to death, you're minorly injured, you're trapped in an evil alleyway in a fetal position, and to make things worse, you missed out on breakfast this morning.

You curl up even tighter, sweat pouring down your body and your teeth chattering with fear. Did you just hear something? What was that?
These questions keep on playing through your mind as you curl up tighter and tighter, just wishing you could dissapear.

If only you could curl up so tight that you shrunk down and down, until you were only as big as the bugs on the ground.............. that becomes your deepest wish at the moment. Nothing really matters anymore, just escaping this terrifying place.

As you curl up into as tiny of a ball you can be, you close your eyes, trying to block out the terrifying darkness.
You can't think straight, and all you do is wish you could become smaller and smaller. You'd rather be dead than be stuck in this place.

After several tense moments of pure horror, you actually start to feel smaller. This makes your spirits sky-rocket, but you still hang on tight- you want to become smaller. Soon, you feel a ton smaller, and and in other words, your confidence is restored. You are still curled up in a small position, but you actually lift up your head and see something- the exit.

You smile, and start inching your way to the exit in your curled up position. It takes a while, but you finally reach the exit.
You are just about to stand up when you see the trees at a nearby park, and strangely start to feel very hungry all over again.

You then look at some rotting food at your side, and realize something disturbing- it looks delicious to you too! Your mind becomes somewhat scared and you can only think of how weird everything seems to be right now. You try to be stand up........ but you can't!

Starting to panic, you look at your body and realize you've transformed into a-

11412.content:
You take a long, deep breath, and slow down to a decent walking pace. See? Now was that so bad?
Grinning at your own foolishness, you continue to calmly stroll down the alleyway.

All it was was a bunch of garbage, right? Sure the air was a little darkish, but now that you slowed down a bit, you actually LIKE it.
The dark air seems cool, and you feel a sense of calmness wash over your entire body. Besides the garbage that was laying around, the alleyway was actually a little peaceful!

You smile in pleasure and gently close your eyes as you walk, allowing a complete sense of calmness to wash over you.
You let the darkness guide your way............ it made you feel pleasurefully calm, and the alleyway was straight anyway.

Soon, you lose yourself in a sensation of calmness, and darkness............ yes, nothing but darkness. Darkness means there is nothing, and nothing means no worries. Nothing but peace.............. and as long as nothing gets in your way, you can feel just fine.

Soon, the darkness of the alley seems to sink into your soul. But you let it do so. More darkness means more power, and more calmness.
Nothing must move. You will destroy anything that moves, anything that dare defies the soothing calmness of the darkness.

Your mind seems to grow in power, and you feel yourself becoming much stronger. Yes............ more darkness! You find yourself beggining to crave the darkness, the need for everything to go black. Also, you gain powerful feelings of hate towards those who dare defy it. Pathetic creatures.......... how could they dare disturb your perfect darkness!?

You feel powerful changes rippiling through your body, and an evil grin turns up on your face.
Darkness is your friend............... you love darknes......................................................................... ........................


Suddenly, a gleam of light touches your face! Your eyes fly open in suprise, and you stumble backwards and fall on your butt.
Ugh, light! Just the thought of light makes you want to spit in disguist. Not only had this 'light' disturbed your perfect darkness, but it had also caused you land on your tail!

Wait a minute.........tail!?
Qucikly you look down at yourself, and gasp in horrow when you see you've transformed into.................

11413.content:
Suddenly, you notice something to your right that makes ou sigh in releif- a door!
"thank goodness" you say aloud, "anywhere is better than THIS place"

You walk up to the door, and notice something odd- there are hinges on the door, but no knob.
Groaning, you try pushing on the door, and to your suprise it swings right open! Since you figured it would be sealed shut, you charge right through and smack into a wall.

"Ow......." you say, rubbing your head. You are a little dizzy from crashing through, so you get up and take a better look around.
You are right in the middle of a hallway, and apparently the door was in the middle of it.

You turn around, and look back at the door. For some odd reason, it was shut again.
Naturally, you check to see if the door will open again, and that's when you start to panic- it isn't opening.

Getting all panicky again, you turn around quickly and take a better look at your surroundings.
You're in a musty old hallway, with peeling wallpaper that's stained brown. There is a single lightbulb in th middle, slowly flickering on and off.

The building you're in is old........................very old. It looks like some sort of old-fashion haunted house from the 30's. There are cobwebs everywhere in here too, and the place looks like it's about to fall apart any second now. Or at least, that's what it looks like from the hallway.

Looking down the hallway you see two directions you can go- left or right. To the left, there seems to be some sort of glowing, like from a TV or something. Also, you have a feeling that someone is over there. In the other direction, all you can see is darkness, but it doesn't seem like anybody is over there.

Which way will you go?
11413.title: wait, is that a door right there?

114131.content:
You look around catiousley for a while, and then your decision becomes final: you will go to the left.
After all, who wants to walk into complete darkness? That would just be stupid! And besides, maybe the person to the left will help you.

As you start to make your way down the hallway, the floor makes a giant creak. Your eyes fly wide open and you step back in fear- did the person in the other room hear you? You focus on the other room, and see a shadow moving against the wall in there.

"Oh crap!" you think to yourself. The other person must've heard you! Quickly you turn around to run, only to realize something else- you have nowhere else to run.
All you can do is stand there and wait for the person for discover you.

After several tense moments, you look at the room and realize that the person left, but not into the hallway.
You take a deep breath, and continue on to the room. Luckily, there are no more squeaky boards along the way.

As you enter the room, you intake as much info as you can about it.
It's old and falling apart, but somewhat creepy, just like the hallway. There is a single TV in the middle just like you suspected, and it has black and white fuzz on the the screen.

"Hello?" you call nervously. No answer.
You figure the person in here must've left the room until you realize a disturbing fact that sends chills down your spine- the only exit ou of the room is the hallway.

You decide to inspect the room a little more- it's not like you can leave whenever you want to.
You see a plush looking chair in the positioned to face the TV, and it looks brand new and out of place with the rest of the room.

Next to the chair is polished wooden table, which also looks out of place. On top of the table is a purple bottle with a note attatched to it.
So naturally, you pick up and read the note. The note says "Inside this purple bottle is a remote to the tv. Please don't *********************-e tv. Thankyou."

You take another look at the note and get frustrated. Someone had scratched out part of it!
You take the remote out of it's bottle, and look at the TV. Should you use the remote on the TV?

Or maybe you should just keep looking around?
114131.title: Go to the left- anything to avoid creepy darkness

115131.content:
You wake up, tired and dozy. Life as a Pokemorph was almost cruel when it came to the morning. Especially if the mornings meant waking up in the sewer like you did everyday. You found it horrible, almost every morph woke up like this everyday. The second parents found out about morphing powers, which due to today's technology was when you were born, they would throw the kids in orphanages because of the hate of today's Pokemorphs. As you get up from the darkness you see your old friend, Megan.

"Hi, Corey, what's up?" she asks you. You reply, "Ugh, nothing really. God, I haven't seen you in a while. You look like you're doing good."

"Well, not really. I came to show you something, but it looks like you just got up. Do you want to come now or later?"
115131.title: An Old Friend

1151311.content:
You tell her, "Aww, how could I resist those cute Pikachu ears? Of course I'll come."

Megan blushes, and then quickly comes to her senses. "I could say the same about that Eevee tail. Alright, just follow me."

You follow her through the sewer. So many morphs have lived down here, the sewers were completely urbanized by the Pokemorphs. An entire community had lived down here for years now. New technology stopped disease from spreading, and stopped the smell from getting up too high. The sewers were huge tunnels and mazes under Ecruteak and Goldenrod, perfect for Pokemorph fugitives.

You read how when the first morphs were sent down here, many of them died of disease due to the sewer's original layout. But soon the morphs and other volunteers worked to change the sewers so hundreds of people could live in them. The Ecruteak-Goldenrod sewers are considered towns now, even if little people know or care about it in this day and age.

As you go through this in your head, Megan says, "We're here." She leads you to a building in the main marketplace and signals you to go inside.
1151311.title: Pokemorph History

11513111.content:
You soon realized why the marketplace was so empty. Only about eighty morphs actually lived in the sewers, and about all of them were in this building. Everyone was quiet. Suddenly, Akuma, the head leader, and esteemed Houndoom morph, walks up on a stage on the other side of the building, with a mic in front of him.

"A crisis has struck the morphs. While our main resources and economics are fine, our safety is not. Today, I was on the above in a meeting with the mayor of Goldenrod and the Gym Leader of Ecruteak, Morty. The sewers need to be used for garbage disposal once again. This could harm our community harshly. Unfortunately, because I am the leader, they believe they need more of an influence to the morphs. I need two teams of two volunteers to talk to them. Any?"

Without anyone being able to make a sound, Megan almost automatically says, "Me and Corey can make one team!" Akuma nods his head in agreement, and scans the room for more volunteers.

You whisper to Megan, "Megan! I haven't been on the above for three years! I'm not ready for this!" She answers, "What's done is done. I like the idea, and the fact that we haven't seen each other for four months makes this good make-up time."

Houndoom has found his other team and ends the meeting. You find the other team and they ask, "Who are you guys gonna talk to?"
11513111.title: The Crisis

115131112.content:
You choose Morty, because he won't be hard to crack.

Ecruteak was much farther though, so you and Megan plan.

You start," Alright, traveling through the sewers to Ecruteak could take an hour or two. Akuma wants us to be quick, so we should go up to Goldenrod first." Megan tries, "Maybe once we gt up on the surface, we can find someone with a car or bike. We could call a taxi." "Hey, what about Whitney. She could drive us, and help us with Morty. But she uses a three-seater bike, and it's slow" you say.
115131112.title: He says....

115132.content:
"Matthew Schatz."

The alakazam-morph stood in front of the class taking role. He looked up as the read the most recent addition to his list to see the hand of a young buizel sticking up in the air. He adjusted his glasses and continued down the paper while the orange-furred appendage disappeared behind the rest of the students.

Matt lowered his hand and returned to playing with his necklace, a mystic water that his dad had given him before he had died. Matt's father had been a member of the Coast Guard, but a terrible boat accident cost him his life. Within a year, his mother moved them to the other side of the country to escape the memories of their old home. She took up a job that paid well but took up most of her time. Now Matt was lost and alone, forced to try and start again by himself.

The rest of class was as uneventful as the role call. It was the first day, so all the teachers would be going over rules and telling the students what they needed for the class. When the bell rang, Matt gathered his stuff and shuffled off to his next class. He had Battle Training in the gym and went to change clothes in the locker room. As he traded his jeans and t-shirt for mesh shorts and a tank, he removed his necklace and debated what to do with it. He didn't want it to get damaged during a battle, but he didn't want to leave it out in the open with his clothes (he didn't have a locker assigned yet). He decided to ask the coach, but suddenly a hand grabbed the precious stone from his.

"Nice rock!" sneered a gengar. "Bet you could get a lot of money for it!"

Matt wanted to beat the crap out of the ghost, but he was flanked by a machoke and a golem and Matt knew he couldn't take them all. Instead, he calmed down and tried to reason with them.

"Please give it back, my dad gave that to me."

The three just laughed.

"Aw, daddy gave him a pwesent!" the gengar mocked him. "Look, kid, I'll forgive you for being new here and not knowing the rules. We run this school, so we take what we want. Got it?"

"Is that so, Eugene?" came a voice behind the gang. "If I recall correctly, I run this school."

It was a meowth, leaning against the wall in a leather jacket and jeans flipping a coin in the air. He caught the coin and shoved it in his pocket before pointing to the blushing gengar, obviously Eugene.

"You wannabes think you're tough by picking on the new kid? Well why don't you take on a bigger challenge? I told you before that if I caught you trying to act tough again, I'd put you in your place. Care to fight me?"

All three immediately clammed up.

"Uh...hi, Ace...wh-why would you think we're picking on him?"

"Give him the necklace."

"Yeah...sure thing, Ace. See? No problem here! C'mon guys," Eugene said and the trio left.

Matt held the necklace close and put it back around his neck. He then turned to face his savior.

"Thanks a lot. This necklace is all I have left of my dad. Who were those jerks?"

"No problem," Ace told him. "They call themselves the 'Rough and Tough' gang, but they're just a bunch of posers. I can bench more than that machoke and the golem has a soft-shell condition. The only one who's actually strong is the gengar. He calls himself 'Shade', but he clams up the second you say his real name. Don't worry about them too much, you probably could have taken them on your own. By the way, my name's Aiden King, but everyone calls me Ace. My dad's the superintendent, which is why they won't fight me; not that I couldnt take them all at once. What's your name?"

Mat introduced himself while Ace took off his jacket to reveal a white muscle shirt and changed out of his jeans into breather shorts.

"Nice to meet you, Matt. Now let's get out there before the coach comes to get us."
115132.title: A Buizel in a New High School

1151321.content:
"King, what took you so long?" the Coach, an arcanine, asked as Ace lead you into the gym. "Just 'cause you have connections doesn't mean you can just show up whenever you want."

"Sorry, Coach, I was helping the new kid. He wants to ask you if you have a place to keep his necklace safe. It's very important to him."

"Well, alright then, I guess I can excuse the two of you. I suppose you're Matthew Schatz? Go ahead and set your necklace on my desk in the office and I'll lock the door. Just don't forget it after class." Matt quickly thanked the Coach and carefully put it on the desk. Once the door was locked, he followed Coach to the center of the gym. "Alright, kids, I assume that by now you all know what to do in a battle. This year we'll be working on strategy and etiquette. First, I want to see what Mr. Schatz brings to the table. Go ahead and take the blue side."

Matt stepped to his side of the marked field. Ace gave him a thumbs up and Matt nodded back. He looked around at the rest of the class: it appeared to be purposely varied so that no one student could have the upper-hand against the whole class. He saw all the types represented and pokemon of every shape and size. He wondered who his opponent would be.

"Alright, now to find you someone to battle. How about you, Mr. Geist? I guess you already know everything I have to say, considering you're talking over me? Take the red side. I want to work on your etiquette this year."

To Matt's disgust, Geist happened to be Shade's last name. The gengar stepped forward with an arrogant grin on his face. But before Matt could dwell on his hatred of the ghost any further, Coach blew his whistle and the battle began.

"We'll play by free rules," Coach said, "So do your best. But DO NOT knock your opponent out!"

Matt took advantage of the momentary lull to charge up a water gun while coach was talking. The whistle blew again and Shade did exactly what Matt wanted him to do: he came in for a close attack. As soon as Shade was close enough, Matt unleashed his water gun, throwing the ghost back to his own side. He followed up with an aqua jet, surrounding himself with water and shooting towards his foe. He was too quick for Shade who was knocked of his feet. Matt jumped back to his own side and confidently motioned for Shade to come to him.

This was enough to infuriate the gengar. He disappeared with a faint attack to appear behind Matt. He punched the sea weasel before he could react, but instead of falling, he turned the force into a somersault and landed facing Shade. Matt then used agility to speed back to Shade. The ghost tried to use a lick attack, but the water pokemon grabbed his tongue and flipped him over, outside of the battlefield. The coach's whistle blew and the match was over. Matt was the winner.

"Outstanding work, Mr. Schatz!" the Coach roared. "That was some of the slickest battling I've ever seen! A+!"

As Matt was carried back to the locker room by the admiring class, Shade got up and brushed himself off. Eric (the machoke) and Rocko (the golem) walked up to him.

"We gotta take that kid out," Shade told his goons. "And I know just how to do it."
1151321.title: Matt has to fight Shade

115221.content:
You sink deeper into the hot springs and let out a sigh. As a fire type, a flareon specifically, water isn't usually your thing. But here on the slopes of Mt. Chimney, the volcanic springs combined with the volcanic ash in the air just makes you feel so at home. It's no wonder it's a fire pokemorph hotspot. Fortunately, being a close friend of the Lavaridge gym leader, you have no problem getting one of the 'reserved' hot springs all to yourself. You don't even have to bother with a swimsuit or anything, which is good, because you swear that you can't truly relax unless you're completely natural. It might actually be that a recent growth spurt has made you outgrow most of your tops, but you're not going to admit that to anyone. It's a little embarrassing. Here you are, only 19, and you've got a chest like some kind of porn star. Your mother nearly flipped out when she saw the "DD" tags on your bras with your latest load of laundry. You've never been one for attention either, either from lecherous guys or jealous girls.

You take a sigh, and partially submerge your head in the water, childishly blowing some bubbles. You came here to relax, and here you are getting all wound up again. This is why Flannery probably wanted you to relax. Relax, relax, how can you relax? School's over. She's already all set up in her granddad's gym. What are you supposed to do? Lavaridge is a nice town, but there's a reason it's almost all retirees. The only thing it's got going for it is the springs, so you can either work as a tour guide or such, or in one of the many retirement homes that hog the springs for their elderly residents. Not exactly an exciting future....maybe you'll do what your older brother did. Go backpacking, go see Hoenn. Your parents aren't for it, as their drifter child never calls or even writes, but what else are you gonna do?

Deal with whoever that is coming up the trail, you decide. Probably another guy thinking he'll be clever and sneak a peek at you. They do it to Flannery all the time, you know. It never works, either. Neither of you are dumb enough to submerge your ears, and you particularly can hear anything within a mile thanks to your wide canine ears. You get out of the pool preemptively. It's sleeked down your orange-red fur, even your chest ruffle. Another girl might enjoy the curvaceous body you've been blessed with, but you've always been a bit of a tomboy, a bit of a scrapper - or at least you were back before guys either refused to wrestle with you or were all too eager. That's why you keep your hair (head-fur) trimmed short, with boyish bangs. You wrap a towel around you, though it clings to you so much it's hardly modest. You go to confront whoever's coming to bother you.
115221.title: Cool down in the heat

choices: Skip to night when Flannery is back.
1152212.content:
You were mildly surprised to see Flannery running towards the hot springs at full tilt, and her face lit up when she saw you, as if she were searching for you. "There you are! I was hoping you'd be here! You'll never guess what I found!" Flannery said as she slowed to a walk before stopping completely in front of you. Your thoughts went back to the first time you had met the young Arcanine morph. Even though most people would assume this at first glance, she was still damn strong, and probably the only other one besides your family that knew you best. If she was excited about something, there was usually a good reason for that. "Well, don't keep me in suspense Flannery, what is it?" You asked her patiently, knowing how she could get. "When I was out walking near the volcano, I came across a human! A regular human! Do you know how rare they are now?" Flannery said, and you could see why she would get excited. Humans either willingly went under a process that changed them into some sort of process that turned them into a pokemorph of some kind, or, rarely, they would opt to stay human. These humans were usually either very influential, or very powerful when it came to politics. But why would a human be near Lavaridge? "Where's the human now Flannery?" You asked her, curiosity abundant in your tone. "At my house, come on, hurry up and get dressed!" Flannery said, and she didn't need to urge you. A few moments later, and you were wearing a shirt and some jeans, following Flannery back to her house. When you and her entered her house, she directed you back towards her room, where the human was supposed to be resting at. And there it was. Pardon, there HE was. He looked kinda young though, at best maybe fifteen. There was something unique about him though, his hair was white, and at the moment it was covering one of his eyes, even though they were closed at the moment. "See, what did I tell you? A real human." Flannery said with a grin on her face. "Yeah, but who is he? He doesn't look anything like any of the other humans that we see on TV." You said, raising an eyebrow. He was actually...kinda cute. For a human. Not that you cared really, it was just an observation. A sudden movement drew both your own and Flannery's gaze towards the human, interrupting your conversation as he let out a little groan, before his hand reached up and grabbed his head. "Awake are you?" Flannery said, and the human let out a neutral sound. "Where am I?" He asked, his voice sounding more mature than a fifteen year old should be. "You're at my house in Lavaridge. Where are you from?" Flannery said as she knelt down next to him, you having decided to stay at the foot of the bed, away from the human for the moment. "Lave...ridge?...Where was I from...?...I don't know...I...can't remember..." The human said, his eye squinting as he tried to think, but nothing was coming to mind apparently. "Amnesia? That's not good...let me see your head." Flannery said, and before the human cold so much as open his eyes, she had already moved him so that way she could check his head. "Let me know if it hurts." Flannery said as she started to push lightly on his head. Finally, when she reached the back of his head, he cringed. "There?" Flannery asked him. "Yeah...kinda like a dull ache." He said, and he still hadn't of opened his eyes. "You must have hit your hit pretty hard. Maybe you fell from somewhere, I did find you near the volcano after all." Flannery said, and the human made another neutral noise. Flannery let him go, but didn't move from where she was at. The human opened his eyes then, and looked around. His first sight was you, and to your surprise, his gaze WASN'T drawn to your chest, but rather your eyes. Your own amber eyes met his steel gray eyes for a few moments before he looked around a bit more. When he saw Flannery as close as she was, he gave out a little cry of surprise before he shot backwards, unfortunately falling off of the bed and onto the ground, landing with a thud and a delayed ow, before he picked himself up, looking at Flannery as she tried not to laugh at what happened. She was slowly failing though. Before she could outright bust out laughing however, you decided now would be a good time to speak up. "Can you at least remember your name?" You asked him, hands on your hips as you shifted your weight onto one leg. "...I think...it's Zero...yeah, that sounds about right." The human, who was apparently named Zero, said before he looked at you and Flannery. "Oh, right, I'm Flannery. I'm the Gym leader here." Flannery said, puffing out her chest as she said so, giving her a proud look. Zero turned his head to look at you then. "I'm Akane." You said, introducing yourself to him. "Nice to meet you two." Zero said as he pulled himself up all the way. He was on the short side, if you and Flannery were to stand next to him, you were certain he'd only be able to reach chest level with you and her. "I don't want to intrude though, so maybe I should leave..." Zero said as he rubbed his head, and was about to do so until Flannery stood in front of him. "Uh-uh. You're not well enough to even make it to the road, let alone to another town. Until you're better, you're staying here." Flannery said with a hint of finality in her voice. Zero tried to argue, but you put a hand on his shoulder. "Trust me when I say this, you won't win this argument." You said, having known Flannery for quite a while now, you knew from experience. You had yet to win an argument with her, and the only way you could solve things was by out smarting her. Sometimes that didn't even work. "Flare, mind helping me take care of amnesia boy here? I have to run the gym and everything, so I won't be able to keep an eye on him to make sure he stays out of trouble." Flannery asked you, surprising you by the sudden request. "I would have to see with my parents first if I can come over for a while first, but I'm sure they won't have a problem." You said as you waved it off. "Don't I get a say in this?" Zero asked rhetorically. "No." Both you and Flannery said at the same time, deciding to answer his question even though you both knew it was rhetorical. Zero started to frown then, and sighed. "Cheer up, if you behave, I'll let you use my private hot springs. Of course, you would have to make sure that we know you're there. Don't want to just show up and strip in front of you." Flannery said with a grin on her face as Zero's face lit red at her words. You just rolled your eyes, but inwardly you were glad that this amnesiac had appeared. Now maybe your life won't be so dull, who knows, if he does remember where he's from, you could help him get back. A perfectly reasonable excuse to go journey through Hoenn. You were also secretly glad that he wasn't a lech like all the other teenage boys. Not once did he just stare at your rack, or Flannery's.

A few moments later, and you were busy setting a few things up in the guest room that you were going to be using while you kept an eye on Zero. He seemed like a good kid, having offered to help you with a few things. Perhaps he just wanted to do something other than just sit around. You briefly wondered if Flannery would object if you used her TV and game system to pass the time. She had left for the Gym to get everything situated for her career as the Gym leader.

Welcome to the WG/Muscle section, for those of you who want to widen their horizons. Big is beautiful here, so bulk up, you'll need it!

And if you're interested in all things pudgy Pokemon (or Digimon), you should take a look at this Yahoo Group: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Fat_Anime_...

It's small now, but with some additions, it could be really great. Feel free to share your stories, artwork, or RPing info there.
12.title: Weight section

choices: …scowled, pushing him back into his room.
121.content:
Ray woke up slow with a slight, “Mrrrrr…” The summer sun was sparkling in through his window and played across his round, orange-furred face. His pudgy brown-furred paw scratched at his white, soft, flabby belly. Smiling, making his cheeks puff even more and his double chin almost become a triple, he threw his tree-trunk like legs over the edge of the bed and sat up, delighting in the feeling of heaviness – his belly took up most of his lap and his bloated pecs rested on top of that. With a grunt, he pushed himself up off of the bed, standing up on his thickened brown furred feet and setting his belly jiggling. Tugging at the waistband of his boxers, he waddled over in front of his full-length mirror and admired his profile. There was no doubting it, he was fat, and loved it. Ray pinched a fat roll on his side, loving how the pair of stripes on his back matched up so well with the curves of flab. His black rope-like tail looked comical placed above his large rump, like a pair of basketballs. Ray was easily one of the largest Raichu morphs around, standing at 6 feet and 420 pounds.

Ray hadn’t been like that for most of his life, though. One day during freshman year, he was pushed around a lot by members of the football team. Wanting to get back at them, he searched for quick ways to bulk up. However, instead of muscle, he found sites dedicated to gaining weight. Intrigued, Ray decided to give it a shot. He looked up some of the tips and recipes and dedicated himself to his task. It was slow going at first. Ray wasn’t used to eating so much, and his metabolism didn’t really lend itself to making fat. He kept at it, though, and delighted in the first weeks that the pounds stayed on. It was all a piece of cake, or two or three, from there. Not wanting to become immobile, Ray still worked out, riding an exercise bike and lifting weights enough to keep him in shape to move his big self around. Most doctors were surprised that a kid his size was as healthy as he was. His size didn’t go to his head, however. Ray stayed just as friendly and jovial as he ever was.

Moving on, today was a week into summer vacation, Ray’s last summer vacation before moving out to college. Considering this fact, Ray wanted to do something special and had made some arrangements. Now was the time: his parents were out for a week on business, and he had the home all to himself.

Well… almost all to himself.

Ray waddled over to his door, opening it as his Pikachu-morph sister, Julie walked by. She turned to him and…

(And for anyone who would like to see a picture of Ray, check out this picture by E. Orpheus: http://www.furaffinity.net/gallery.fpd?n... )
121.title: No Morning like a Fat Morning

choices: …you were going to help feed me today."
…Today's the day we start /your/ bulk-up diet!"
1211.content:
Julie smiled at her big big brother. She was a Pikachu morph a few years younger than him. Julie was always a bit embarrassed by her size. She was a mousy little girl, and never really “blossomed” into womanhood, so to speak. There had been a few times where she had been mistaken for a boy even, and it had burned her up. She dived at him, knocking him over as she hugged herself against his soft tummy. Julie tickled at Ray’s love handles and back rolls. She nuzzled his chest, loving his smell. It always reminded her of honey-baked ham for some reason. Yeah, she was weird like that.

Ray chuckled, sending his belly and sister jiggling. “Heya sis! You’re in a good mood,” he said with a smile.

Julie giggled back. “Of course I am, silly! You didn’t forget what we’re doing today, did you?” she replied, mock-pouting.

Ray grinned wide, stretching the yellow circles on his cheeks into ovals along his fat face. “Of course not…
