Craig slowly woke up when he noticed that his phone was ringing, but thankfully, he muted the ringer before going to bed, he didn't want to wake up the guy obsessed with his muscles. He answered the phone and instead of hearing a voice, he just heard the dial tone.

"That's strange, did someone call me just to hang up on me?" He murmured to himself.

He then looked at his phone's clock. Surprisingly, it was 3 in the morning.

"I woke up for that? I've got classes at 8! I can't be bothered by things like this." So Craig decided to go back to bed.

A minute later, the phone rings again. Craig didn't want to answer this time, so he let it rang and hoped that the mysterious person would leave a message.

When it was finished, he noticed that there wasn't any message or even a text from the unknown caller. Craig was beginning to freak out. He didn't like random callers, and when they kept calling him, he would get nervous and jittery.

Thankfully, Craig stopped receiving these mysterious calls and calmed down. Swiping the sweat off his muzzle, he went back to bed.

The day went on as usual, with Craig saying goodbye to his roommate, he went to his classes, and got a huge lunch. He was still worried about the caller though. He would start to shake his claws involuntarily when he worried too much. Craig did have a couple tricks up his sleeve when he dealt with situations like this, food always helped him calm down. When he didn't have any food available, he would play with his belly or jump up and down to see how long his body jiggled. He would always laugh and he would feel better afterwards with a big smile on his face.

A month passed by, and Craig was beginning to feel comfortable at his new home. He still didn't talk to Brian because he was afraid that he might make fun of him. But he did have new friends. Well actually, he only had 2 friends, and one was always busy so, he basically had only one friend.

Craig woke up and slowly got up out of bed. For a second, he noticed that it was getting difficult to get up from bed but he shook that thought away quickly. He instead thought that his bed wasn't very good, and he had no support to hold on to when getting up.

It was in the early morning, and Brian was still sound asleep. Since Craig knew that Brian didn't really care that he was naked, Craig had begun to sleep in the nude more often. It felt natural for Craig and besides, his underwear was always drenched in sweat, and Craig didn't feel like cleaning his clothes every day. He still cleaned up after Brian and himself, Brian's messes would annoy Craig to no end.

A chubby growlith morph strode down the hallways of the 6th Saffron police department. Her large rump swaying back and forth as she walked. Her uniform was clearly a size or two too small and hugged her form tightly, riding up slightly on her pudgy belly. In one hand she held a large cup of coffee, and slung under the other pudgy arm was a large box of doughnuts.

In the past several months she had become addicted to them and he once trim and fit body began to put on weight, and she was reassigned to dispatch at the police department. The combination of now sitting the whole day instead of being out on the beat and having a lot of downtime to eat only compounded her problem and made her somewhat frustrated, as she wanted to get back on her beat but couldn’t seem to stop eating.

By Saturday morning, she was starting to worry. What if she couldn't lose the weight? What if it came back later? And even worse, she had begun to wonder about Paul's sudden shift in mood. He had always seemed to be happy and upbeat around her, but there was no mistaking the look of unease that had come over him when she asked him to help her.

It was with no small amount of trepidation that she opened the door to let her friend in, and the false smile he had on didn't fool her for a second.
"Hi, Paul, thanks for coming over."
"It's no problem. I know you want out of that crummy desk job."

Jenny led Paul in and moved to her living room. She sat down on her couch while Paul looked around the room.
"So, Jenny, did you have any sort of plan in mind?"
"Plan?"
"Yeah, you know. An exercise routine, fitness plan, workout schedule?"
Jenny realized she hadn't made any preparations for this at all. "Er... No, I hadn't. I've never really tried this before. I was sort of hoping you could help me get started."

Paul walked over and sat down next to Jenny on the couch.
"Hm. Well, how serious about this are you?"
"What's that suppossed to mean?"
"Wait, let me rephrase that!" Paul quickly cried, "What I mean is, how hard do you want to go at this? We can go at any pace you want, of course. And if things start getting too hard, we can always tone the activities down a bit."

Jenny bit her lip. "Hm... That's good to know. But still, the fitness test is in less than two months. And I've got a lot of catching up to do if I want to look as good as you." After a very brief pause, she added, "I mean, as fit and in shape, of course!"
Paul's eyes rose in slight surprise. "Huh? As fit as me? You don't just want to lose what you need to to pass the test?"

While Pauline was doing her best to get up into Ellen's face, and the eevee reacted with folded back ears and shrinking back a bit, much of the lecture went over her head. The final line was what really caught her attention though.

"I've cut you slack with this for a while, but I just can't any more, how many times do you think I've seen you and not said anything, If I catch you one more time you can start looking for another job!" 12422.title: Caught Red Handed

124221.content:
Ellen tried to put a halt to her snacking, but half the time wasn't even aware of the food her hands were guiding into her mouth. There was no way Pauline would buy this little 'compulsion' of hers. She had to do something to break it. But what? Ellen was pondering this as she overheard the customers at a particularly nearby table, one ear perking up and homing in like a radar dish.

"Come on honey, don't you want dessert?"

"Oof, no thanks, I couldn't eat another bite."

"But they have your favorite!"

"Hun, they could serve it on a gold platter for all I care. If I'm stuffed, I'm stuffed."

This little conversation caused an epiphany in Ellen. She nearly squealed in excitement. Of course! The problem was that her constant grazing kept her at a comfortable level of fullness, but never full enough that she felt the need to stop. What she needed was to simply make more food seem so unappetizing to her that she'd soon break her little habit. Ellen kept her plan in mind right until her own lunch break, which naturally came sometime later than usual to account for the restaurant's lunchtime rush. The mere thought of how much she'd eat kept Ellen occupied enough that she stopped her constant munching. For the first time in what felt like weeks, she was actually decently hungry when she sat down for her meal. She had cooked herself a meal right off the restaurant's menu, which was what she was quite used to. A meatball sandwich, an entire plate of fries, of course one of their stew-of-the-day stews, and a lunch omelet to err on the side of caution. Such a mini-feast didn't even garner her any looks from the rest of the kitchen staff - really, Ellen wasn't alone in her eating habits, simply the worst offender. She dug in with gusto.

To Ellen's surprise, she didn't have nearly the appetite she expected. Oh, sure, over the course of the average work day she might put away a few thousand calories' worth of food, but never much at once. She had never pushed her stomach's capacity. Still, she was determined. Eating a regular sized meal would just make her get back to snacking thirty minutes later. So she forced it all down. First the sandwich, which she truly enjoyed. She alternated with the stew and fries, and that she began to struggle with. She figured the stew would go down easy, giving her a more complete fullness, but it sat so heavy in her stomach. By the time she finished, she was eying the omelet with trepidation. Still, that was the point. To, for once in her life, not want to eat. So she began to cut up the omelet and cram it down, bite after bite. It nearly brought tears to her eyes. A couple of disturbed (and barely hidden) burps made things easier, but not for long. Ellen was getting some looks from the staff now, some put-off, others curious or even interested. Finally, with a clatter of knife and fork, Ellen finished the last of her meal. She sat back with a groan. It looked like half her fellow cooks were about to applaud her. Ellen just sat there and tried to comfort her bloated stomach, which was trying its best to churn with so much in it. She glanced at her watch. Only a few minutes before their lunch break was over. Ellen was not looking forward to getting up. But at least she could already see herself refusing her usual snacks.

Over the next two weeks, Ellen soon learned that a big lunch wasn't enough. She started getting up earlier to give her time to eat a positively huge breakfast to tie her over to lunch. Her dinners started getting a lot bigger too, although that was less about work and more about her quickly-changing eating habits. By the end of two weeks, she's....

Ellen sat at her food-prep station, idly rubbing her belly. She was stuffed from her meals- all the time. Her snacking habit had all but disappeared under the crushing amount of food she consumed at mealtimes... but in place of her snacking had come a few extra pounds. All of Ellen's pants were now poorly fitting, as her previous bubble butt had slowly swollen into a badonkadonk, eating up her panties and thongs and making pants extremely tight on her. Her small potbelly had grown a little bit more, and was a little wobbly whenever he moved around. Her breasts, decent to begin with, hadn't changed much, but had grown slightly- not quite a whole cupsize yet.

"Excuse me, are you, uh, Erin? No, that's not right, let me try again... Elena? Ellen! That's it, you're Ellen, yes?"

Ellen turned slowly, and was shocked to see a towering Machamp morph towering over her, almost a whole foot taller then her! His sculpted muscles and chiseled abs were visible through his form-fitting muscle shirt, though not much could be said about his legs- they were long, and hidden behind a pair of sweatpants.

"Yes, I'm Ellen. Why? And who are you, anyways?"

The Machamp morph grinned. "My name is Edward. Edward Stone. Do you remember you're boss Paulina? She was transferred to the Stew Pot branch in Celadon. I'm her replacement. Anyways, a few employees have informed me that you have been prevented from snacking on the job, right?"

"Yeah... why...?" asked Ellen, rather confused at where the conversation was going.

"You can snack all you want now, as long as you aren't eating a customer's meals or snacking without working. That was all I wanted to say. If you need anything, come see me!" said Edward as he turned on his heel and left Ellen alone.

1242212.content:
Ellen handed off her most recent dish to the waitress and grabbed a handful of fries from the leftovers coming in. The hand that grabbed them was rather portly-looking, with even the fingers thicker than they had been. Ellen smiled as she chewed, her double chin jostling with the motion. She still wasn't fully aware of all the snacks she took. Oh, she was typically better, but only at hiding it from her boss. Despite now packing away enough for a three-person family at each meal, Ellen had definitely not stopped her nearly constant intake of food. And it showed. She had graduated to the largest size uniform the Stew Pot had in stock, and even that was tight against her big, round belly. It was almost always too full to have a proper fold in it, more like a heavy balloon hanging from her. It was framed by now visible love handles situated atop a pair of hips that made Ellen fond of double doors and curse the narrower doorways of her home. Her bubble butt had become a full on badonkadonk, a booty she could've rested a pair of dinner plates on. Even her breasts got in on the action, full and jiggling D-cups that framed the top shelf of her belly nicely. Ellen was a bubbly person in body and personality now, that was for sure.

"Listen up people!" Pauline called, entering the kitchen brusquely. She made Ellen jump, and wipe the grease from her chin as best she could with the back of her hand. That just made the fur on the back of her hand even greasier. She began to lick it surreptitiously as Pauline spoke to the hastily assembled staff.

"Leonard Cambela is on vacation, and guess which 'local flavor' he decided to check out?" she asked. Several of the chefs groaned. Ellen looked around in confusion.

"That's right. I'm going to need a volunteer. Come on, let's be adults about this, before I make you draw straws." Pauline told them, hands on her hips. Ellen tentatively raised her hand.

"Um..."

"Good, Ellen, it's settled then."

"N-no, I just wanted to know who's-"

"Doesn't matter." Pauline said, walking over to her. "You're it. And if I see so much as a stale fry in your mouth while working, we'll be serving him stuffed eevee instead." she ended with a sharp poke in Ellen's gut. It was probably meant to hurt, but Ellen had so much padding that it just made her jiggle. Ellen barely suppressed a giggle. Pauline turned away in disgust. Ellen looked around, finding looks of sorrow and condolences all around.

"Who's Leonard ca-whatever?" she asked allowed. An older chef, a Zangoose whose fur was more gray than white, put an arm around her and patted her sadly.

"The king of food critics, like Satan's the king of devils. Most critics want an authentic experience, but not him. He makes himself known, since no matter what you do, chances are he'll tear you apart. Restaurants live or die...mostly die...by his word."

The whole time, Ellen had shrunk herself down as much as she could. She let out a whimper, ears flat against her head and her tail plastered between her massive cheeks.

"But...he's on vacation, right?"

"Oh, yes." the zangoose let her go. "So we'll - and I mean you - will be chewed out on his blog, facebook, and twitter instead of professionally."

"Twitter?"

"He packs so much venom into 250 characters, it's an art form." the zangoose wandered off. Ellen gulped.

"Order up!" A waitress called. "....from Cambela." Ellen took the order. She took a deep breath and got to work. Her binges had done more than just work on her figure. She had, for variety's sake, gotten to cooking massive amounts of every type of dish she could think of. Cambela's order for honey-roasted pig and a side of minced vegetables, even if they technically didn't serve any of that, was no problem. Ellen got to work.

Several minutes later, all Ellen could do was pace. She had served her food, there was nothing to do but wait. The entire staff was nervous. Ellen feared the worst. Another chef, seeing her worry, handed her a plate of hash browns. Ellen took them thankfully and began to munch.

"How goes the - ah ha!" Pauline burst in. Ellen froze.

"Ellen! You pig! Can you not stop eating for one minute!" Pauline stormed up to her. She had to reach her arm out as much as she could to waggle her finger in Ellen's face.

"I oughta, I oughta-"

"Wh-here is she?" came an accented call, "Whhere is ze chef zat prepared my meal?!" a small, pear shaped Empoleon barged in. Pauline stepped aside, looked at him, and grinned.

"That would be her!" she said. Ellen wrung her hands and whimpered. The Empoleon, who was honest-to-goodness wearing a monocle, studied her up and down. He approached her, and then suddenly grabbed her hand.

"Madmoiselle." he said, kissing her hand, "I never expected to find, of all things, cuisine in such a, how you say, a dump? Truly, you are a chef among chefs, as a king among kings!"

Ellen, Pauline, and everyone else's jaws dropped. The empoleon kissed her hand again.

"Erm...thank you." Ellen said, "I aim to please."

"Ah, such sweetness, as well! An exampleh to chefs everywhere!" he pulled out a card. "But my words, they have a double entendre, how you say, two meanings? I am exhhhausted with the world of a critic. I want to start my own restaurant, to show these simpletons how it is done. I want, no, need a chef such as yourself."

If Ellen's jaw had been hanging before, it hit the floor now. She could only imagine what kind've restaurant this guy would run. She would be moving up in the world.

"You can't!" Pauline interrupted. "I mean, you can't take my head chef from me, now can you."

"Head, chef?" Ellen asked in a squeak. Pauline nodded.

"Of course. Who else would get to design my menu?" Pauline said with a wide, unnatural grin. Ellen hesitated, glancing from the empoleon to her boss.

"Well, well I think I'll...."

"I'm sorry, uh, Mon-sewer, but there's no way I could leave this place." Ellen said. Pauline's grin widened so far it almost split her head off. But Ellen wasn't done.

"After all, I was just up for a raise here, right boss?" she asked. Pauline's grin lessened a little, but she nodded.

Madmoiselle, your cooking is divine, and Madame, I shall extol ze virtues of your restaurant to my publishers! This place is, how they say, a diamond in ze rough!" he waddled out of the kitchen. Pauline had claimed to always want to put in a bar and TVs, and whether that was true or not, they had finally gotten the money to renovate as the restaurant had skyrocketed in popularity. Ellen had taught people how to make food fun again, while still delicious. A plate of nachos absolutely swimming in cheese, salsa and their own blend of spices. Perhaps the elaborate displays they put on with their arrangements of wings and onion rings went over most customer's heads, but there had to be some reason people kept overpaying for them. Pauline spent her days salivating over the money they were making these days, but the rest of the staff salivated over their own cooking, mostly Ellen's. She could make a grilled cheese sandwich taste like fine dining. Quality ingredients helped, unlike the yellow plastic most places called cheese, but Ellen just brought spirit back to the place. The short Delcatty had finally tried some of Ellen's cooking after that incident with the critic, and shortly after mysterious, and increasingly massive orders for 'quality testing' made their way into the kitchen. She had left most of the design to Pauline, who knew funny things like traffic logistics and optimal waiter pathways, but had definitely added her own touch here and there. "Gas is fine, the vent's working, oh dear, where did the spatulas go..." she mumbled to herself. Ellen smiled to herself. She approached Abagail as the chef bent over to check some cupboard or other. 12422122112.title: Almost open for business

124221221121.content:
Ellen sighed and gladly turned the sign on the front door to 'closed'. Another busy day. Like Pauline had expected, a second Stew Pot right in the heart of downtown had hit it off greatly. They already had a full time bartender and another apprentice, as people were often using this place as a relaxed bar. Still, they got quite a few coming in for meals, mostly college students from a local community college in the inner city. It meant Ellen was cooking more pizza these days than everything else combined, but she got tons of compliments from college kids shocked to find that pizza crust didn't have to taste like cardboard, or that tomato sauce wasn't the same as ketchup. Still, it took a lot to keep this place going, and they had had to hire quickly, including a couple of more inexperienced chefs that drove Ellen and Abagail ragged.

That probably explained why the Abagail who approached Ellen now was a different Abagail from a couple days ago. She had bags under her eyes, an impressive feat given how dark furred she was. She look worn, slightly puffy arms limp at her side. A hairnet dangled in one hand, and her unruly black hair now threatened to block her eyesight. Ellen gave her a sympathetic look.

"I....Ellen, I don't think I can do it." Abagail sputtered out. "I just....this isn't like the old Stew Pot. We had 8 chefs. I had to take a couple orders a hour. Now....they, they can't keep up. I have to help them. I can't keep up..."

"Pauline understaffed us, I know." Ellen replied. "But it'll get better, Abagail. Don't worry."

"But, but how do you even manage?"

"Well...mostly with food, really." Ellen replied, patting her big round gut. Abagail blushed and rubbed her nose.

"Is that really a good idea?" she asked. Ellen shrugged.

"I'm not really having any trouble. I'd say it's a small price to pay for some comfort, but hey, the 'price' is a different kind of comfort, y'know?" she patted her side this time, referring to her bubble butt. Abagail looked like she was going to burn through the fur on her cheeks. She looked down at herself and put a hand on her pot belly.

"I guess I'm doing some of that myself. But...I don't know, I guess it doesn't work for me."

"Hmm." Ellen pursed her lips. "Listen, I know just what you need. Heck, I could use it to."

"W-what?" Abagail asked. Ellen smiled.

"You need..."

"It's nearly Sunday, and we close practically at half-day." Ellen said. "Why don't you and I head over to that new spa a few blocks down? I was thinking of going....even after my food bill I've got a bit of splurging cash. So why not come along?"

"Err...I, I don't make that much, and-"

"Oh, I'll have to ask Pauline about that. But hey, my treat then. Come on?" Ellen gave Abagail a playful nudge.

"W-well...okay." Abagail finally replied, giving an adorable little smile. Ellen chuckled and ruffled her hair.

"Great. Just hold out until then."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----------------------------------

Sunday finally came. "Alright, Melony, Victor, you two clean up and let Georg know when you're heading out, okay?" Ellen called as she exited the kitchen, Abagail following in her shadow. Abagail glanced back.

"Are you sure it's fair...we're not even closed properly."

"Oh, please. Georg's got seniority, and they can handle whatever's left. Besides, I'm basically the boss, remember? I say we're taking the rest of the day off. Now lets go, I called a cab. Ooh goody, it's already here." Ellen said as she headed outside. She had changed out of her chef's apron into a giant blue sweater to deal with the fall chill. Her backside was stuffed into the fattest pair of skinny jeans Abagail had ever seen. All around, from her muffin top to the cleavage pouring out of her sweater's neck hole, Ellen was clearly stuffed into far too small an outfit. Abagail's own was looking a bit tight as that.

Ellen held the door open, and Abagail muttered her thanks and got in. She turned around right as it suddenly went darker inside the cab. Ellen's frame blocked out the doorway. Her ass came in first, and for a moment Abagail panicked, afraid she was about to be crushed as it inched in on her. Moving to the far side, however, kept her from being sat on as Ellen maneuvered the rest of her body in. Abagail was right against the door, Ellen taking up over half the backseat. She fidgeted with the seatbelt, only just getting it to reach by getting the shoulder strap in her cleavage and the waistband partially underneath her gut. She grinned over at Abagail.

"Maybe we should've called for a tow truck. Alright mac, to 53rd and 8th." she called the last part to the driver. Abagail was staring in awe at the way Ellen filled so much of the cab, her bottom actually pressed up against the poochyena.

"It...doesn't bother you?" Abagail finally asked. Ellen hesitated, then shrugged.

"Some things are annoying. Like I'm probably going to have to find a bigger home soon. But mostly, it's just fun being so big and squishy. Besides, if it means I get to cook and eat to my heart's content, why not?" she patted her gut. "I feel better than ever, even with the stress." Abagail nodded silently, her eyes still on Ellen.

The two quickly arrived at the spa. Ellen insisted on paying the cab fair. Inside the spa they were greeted with soft music and the aroma of flowers. Ellen took a deep breathe and waddled over to the counter.

"I feel better already." she told Abagail. Abagail nodded. Ellen picked up a little sign on top of the receptionist's desk and read it.

"Two silver packages sounds about right. Access to the sauna, a couple massages....not sure about the mud bath, but they have a jacuzzi. Yea, we'll take those." she told the receptionist. After paying, Ellen turned to Abagail.

"So what do you want to do first?"

"Me?"

"I'm not picky. Whatever sounds good to you."

"Oh, okay then...let's go..."

The next week at work...

She handed off her order to the kitchen and went off, spying a table needing another pitcher of soda.

Inside the kitchen, cooks worked at an organized but furious pace. Plate after plate literally piled high with food made it's way from the kitchen like a streamlined factory system. Critics were raving about the Stew Pot, whose proportions far outclassed any other restaurant, even considering the fact that everything was well overpriced. And the quality....by this point, Ellen had turn every chef under her into a master of casual dining. And it showed. The only thing that slowed down production once and a while was a pair of bellies bumping together as a chef turned around, not used to their girth. An even mix of male and female morphs, the kitchen looked more crowded than it really was given how much room each one took up.

"Alright people, how are we doing?" Ellen asked, returning to the kitchen from her lunch break. She got away with a couple lunches by taking one early and one late, so she could keep the kitchen going through all other lunch shifts. People instinctively made room for her, because even with the width of space in the kitchen originally designed for her bulk, now that there were a dozen bulky frames around Ellen didn't have room to squeeze by. Ellen's body was starting to round out. Previously belly heavy to the extent that she was nearly longer than she was wide, fat had piled on to her sides, so that her belly seemed one giant glob of fat that had melted around her, surrounding her completely with the thick coating on her back as well. It was still very round, that was to be sure, wobbling and bouncing against her monstrous thighs. As if knowing how short she was, i.e. how little room she had, her body had decided to store the majority of the weight out of the weigh, behind her, giving her a giant bubble but that crowded her thickened tail and actually rested against the backs of her legs. But that wasn't to say the rest of her was thin. It's like..." She rubbed her gut, eyes drifting over to the snack bar. "It's like if I ate everything on that bar for lunch. That would cover only about half my usual, maybe even less."

I would've had to cut back a while ago if I didn't get paid as much I do. Plus there's the space issue I told you about earlier."

         "And I am Irene," stated the other. "We will be your personal masseuses for today. And before you ask: yes, we are twins."

         Ellen chuckled and shook Elaine's hand. Turning to Abagail, she said, "Well, see you when you're done."

         "You too," the Poochyena responded. She turned to Irene. "I guess we'll be getting started now."

         "Of course. Please follow me."

------

One heavenly massage later...
12422122112122.title: "...get massages."

choices: "Would you be willing to stay the night at my place? I'll treat you to dinner."
"I'm really grateful I have you around."
124221221121221.content:
Neither Ellen nor Abagail could bring themselves to speak, the both of them too lost in post-massage bliss to form coherent words. The Dragonair twins exchanged knowing glances and smiled at them.

         "If you want," Elaine began, "we can guide you to your next desired destination while you regain your mental faculties."

         Ellen's only response was to moan and grin dazedly at the ceiling. Abagail's was much the same. Elaine cocked an eyebrow and turned to Irene, who shrugged in response.

         "We will assume that means 'yes'," Irene said. "Where would you like to head next?"

         "Sssaaaaauuuunnaaaa..." Ellen moaned, her gaze still fixed on the ceiling. Abagail hummed in agreement.

         The masseuses smirked. "Of course," said Elaine. "And given your (ahem!) satisfaction with your massages, we're certain our sauna facilities will be to your liking as well. Now then, if you two would please follow us, we'll show you to the changing room."

------

         Thankfully, it didn't take long for the bliss to wear off, so the Dragonairs had no trouble getting Ellen and Abagail to follow them. Once they were at the changing room, the twins informed them they would find a set of towels in the lockers they would be assigned to, then left after promising to return with locker keys. Abagail took a moment to admire the place. The lockers had a wood finish colored a light tan. They used lock-and-key instead of the digital keypads most spas used nowadays. Low-tech, but still effective. The tiled floor was more of a soft peach. Maybe not the best complement to the lockers, but it wasn't a strain on the eyes either.

         "Not the most spacious locker room, is it?" Ellen muttered as she scanned the room. "Oh well, it's not like I'm the standard."

         Abagail just nodded, though she wasn't sure if Ellen was even looking at her. They stood around awkwardly for a couple minutes before the Dragonair twins returned with their keys. 23 for Ellen, 24 for Abagail. The twins left again, and the two found their lockers over on the right wall.

         "I'm guessing you'll want to change in private, right?" Ellen asked as she opened her locker.

         Abagail blushed and looked down at her feet, slightly obscured by the swell of her belly. "Um, y-yeah. See you in the sauna?"

         "Sure thing." The Eevee scowled at the stack of towels inside. "Seriously?" she muttered. "They expect these dinky things to cover me?"

         Before thoughts of Ellen failing to cover herself with tiny towels could invade her mind, Abagail quickly opened her own locker, snatched the towels, and bolted over to the showers. She then waited for her breathing to return to normal and her blush to die down. After that, she slowly peeled her clothes off, starting with her shirt and working her way down before removing her bra and panties last.

         The Poochyena's body was a mid-to-bottom-heavy, more mid than bottom. Beyond her average breasts was a round belly just beginning to sag. Her butt, while a step above her breasts, was still rather average overall, as were her hips. Everything had a distinctly pudgy quality to it, but she lacked fat folds and what curves she had were meager.

         Then again, anything looked meager next to Ellen. She was a true paragon of massiveness, and seemed to become more of one with each passing day. The Eevee's stomach dominated her body and demanded the most attention, but overlooking her bust and rear was an impossible feat. It was nothing short of a miracle she could find any clothes that fit at all. And not just the size was impressive, but the way she managed to carry it all, both literally and figuratively. Not once did Abagail ever see her falter on those massive tree trunk legs of hers or get winded by her mighty bulk. Maybe she did a little exercise on the side...

         But more impressively than that was how natural Ellen made it all look. Cellulite was like a foreign concept to her, with only her love handles doing anything to interrupt her body's curvature, and all those did were add to the effect rather than detract. The cute, plump Eevee of a few weeks had transformed into a magnificent goddess of corpulence who--

         Wait, where am I going with this?

         Shaking her head, Abagail realized she was still standing naked in the shower stall and hastily wrapped the average-sized towels around herself. She made her way back to her locker, peeking around the corner to see if Ellen was still there. To her relief, she wasn't. The Poochyena stuffed her clothes and remaining towels in. The largest towel was a bit much for her, but it didn't seem adequate for Ellen. In that case, how much could it cover...?

------

         Barely enough, as it turned out.

         Abagail stopped dead in her tracks the moment she laid eyes on Ellen. Her ample butt dominated most of the bench she sat on, but that detail barely registered compared to how little the Eevee's towel managed to cover. It was draped over her like a blanket, and the only modesty it granted was about half of each nipple. Ellen tried turning it around horizontally and got better results. Her breasts and part of her belly were concealed, but her lower half was still exposed. Thankfully, the gargantuan orb of flesh kept her privates hidden from sight. She shrugged and leaned back, spreading her legs to give her belly room.

         "And this is the biggest one they've got," she muttered to herself before looking over to the door. "Oh, there you are."

         This shouldn't have shocked her so much, Abagail knew that. Even so, seeing so much exposed fur on one person was...well, it was an experience her vocabulary couldn't properly describe. She just stood in the door way, her mind desperately scrambling to comprehend the vast amount of unclothed woman sitting before her as well as her reaction to said sight.

         "Hey." Ellen cocked her head to one said. For some reason, Abagail did the same. "Uh, you alright there, Abby?"

         The Poochyena blinked. "Uh."

         "C'mon, Abby, have a seat already."

         "Ah..." Abagail slowly moved to a different bench and sat down. "Abby..."

         Ellen gave her a quizzical look. "Yeah, that's what I've been calling you. Why, does it bother you?"

         Abagail blinked once. Then twice. Then several more times. Then she shook her head rapidly. "U-um, uh, n-no, no! Not at all! Sorry! I guess I just, I just... Well..."
She sighed. "Sorry."

         "For what?"

         She fidgeted a little. Her eyes were glued to the floor. "I don't know. My reaction, I guess. I know you're big, but seeing you n-n-naked is... It's..."

         "Totally different from seeing me in clothes that hardly fit?" Ellen chuckled. "But really, does it bother you that much?"

         Abagail shook her head again. "It's not that. You..." She took a deep breath and forced herself to look at the massive Eevee. "You amaze me, Ellen."

         Ellen didn't respond for a minute. She just stared back, her mouth trying to form words that wouldn't come. Finally, she asked, "Amaze you?"

         Abagail nodded, a blush forming on her cheeks. It took a minute to decide where she wanted to start. "You handle everything so well. The Stew Pot, the stress, your weight... Everything. And when Pauline made you boss of the new branch, you never stopped being nice. Sure, you've been acting a little different, but you're in charge now, so you're just being a nice boss instead of a nice coworker. And you always know how to calm me down. How do you do that? How do you stay so calm about everything? I'd probably be freaking out about how fat I was getting if I were in your position, but you just take it so well and make it look so good and, and comforting... And you're one of the most amazing people I've ever met."

         Silence fell between the two, and Abagail looked back to the floor. She could hear her heart pounding away in her chest. Clenching her hands into fists, she slowed her breathing and closed her eyes. Her mind was in a tizzy thanks to her declaration.

         "Abby?"

         A second's delay, then she opened her eyes and met Ellen's. The Eevee smiled warmly.
124221221121221.title: Winding Down

choices: Abagail eats a lot, impressing both herself and Ellen.
She tries her best, but barely dents the feast before falling into a food coma.
1242212211212211.content:
"T-The night?" Abagail could feel her face burning, and it wasn't from the sauna. "As in the whole night?"

         Ellen snorted. "What else would I mean? I wouldn't kick you out at two in the morning or something like that."

         "Right, of course." Abagail forced a laugh. "Silly me..."

         "So what do you say?" Ellen leaned forward, as if expectant. In a sing-song voice she added, "It's a free dinner, and a free breakfast if you stick around in the morning!"

         Drool began pooling in Abagail's mouth. Two free meals made by Ellen herself?! Who could say no to that?! Abagail swallowed. "Okay," she said, trying to keep the shakiness out of her voice.

         "Perfect!" Ellen clapped her hands together and a ripple went through her fat. "Thanks, Abby! I promise I'll give you the best dinner you've ever had!"

         Unsure how to respond, Abagail opted for a simple nod. She thought she saw hints of a blush on Ellen's cheeks, but wrote it off as a trick of the eye. Whatever could possibly break through Ellen's unflappable composure and make her blush? There was no way.

         The two of them sat in silence for a while. There was no scent, but Abagail deeply inhaled the air anyway. She had almost forgotten what it felt like to truly relax. The massage left her feeling loose, if a bit disoriented from just how good it was. This felt like everything was easing back into place. Maybe now she wouldn't fret so much over every last thing at work. Well, she probably would, but at least she wouldn't be as stressed out over everything.

         Ellen most likely felt the same, Abagail thought. It was hard to imagine, but Ellen herself did admit she got stressed too. She just handled it so much better, and got such great results.

         Wait, what?

         Abagail blinked. Apparently, she'd been staring at Ellen for some time. And judging by the grin, Ellen had noticed. It practically felt like Abagail's whole face had caught fire. She stammered out an apology and covered her face and despite realizing the futility of her gesture. That got a laugh out of Ellen.

         "Oh, just relax already! You're hardly the first!"

         Abagail winced and tried to curl up into a ball. "That doesn't make it any less rude!"

         Ellen laughed again. "Maybe! But at least you weren't being judgmental!" In a calmer voice, she added, "If anything, you seemed a little...appreciative."

         A confused squeak escaped Abagail's lips. She forced herself to pull her hands away. Ellen was still smiling. And blushing? No, she couldn't be. Could she...?

         "S-So anyway," Abagail said, "if you don't mind my asking, what are having for dinner tonight?" She inwardly cringed at the obvious panic in her voice. Why, oh why can't she ever calm down around her boss?

         Ellen stroked her belly and hummed thoughtfully. "That's a good question. I usually just whip up whatever random stuff I find, to be honest. Why? Got anything in mind?"

         "Oh, no! No! I was just asking!"

         "Are you sure? 'Cause I'll make whatever you want."

         And once again, Abagail's cheeks were set aflame. "It doesn't matter to me, really! I know I'll love whatever you end up making! You're the best cook I've ever met, after all!"

         Why did I add that last part?

         This time she was sure she didn't imagine Ellen blushing. She gave Abagail a bashful look. "Aw, thanks Abby. And you're the sweetest girl I've ever met."

         The resulting rush of blood to Abagail's cheeks very nearly knocked her out.

------

         "So, um, how much of this am I supposed to eat?"

         They went straight home after the spa. Ellen's home. It was a one-story of average size. Nothing about it really screamed extravagant; the old-looking furniture and decorations suggested most of her things were hand-me-downs courtesy of her parents. This wasn't a bad thing, as it gave the place a more homey feel that made it easier to get comfortable. At least, that's how Abagail felt.

         The only exception was the dining room which, according to Ellen, was the biggest room in the house. The dining table was considerably large, and it looked pretty new. At least, that was impression Abagail got before Ellen started setting all the food. She had started preparing everything as soon as they got back. Abagail waited as patiently as she could, but all the delicious aroma's were giving her self-restraint quite the workout. She managed to hold out, though. Barely.

         To be fair, it was all mouth-watering. From simple foods like mac & cheese and grilled sausage, to more elaborate foods like chicken salad and lasagna (store-bought in the latter's case), dinner was a real hodgepodge of a feast.

         "As much as you want," Ellen said as she set down a pot of chili. The apron she wore had a multitude of stains and hugged her body tightly.

         "In other words, as much as I can." Abagail gulped. Surely she wouldn't have to wait too much longer.

         "That's the idea." Ellen pulled a couple of plates out from a nearby cabinet. "I know it seems like a lot, but don't forget most of this is for me." With a wink, she placed a plate down in front of Abagail and added, "Just do your best and I'll take care of any leftovers."

         Abagail warily eyed a giant pot of pasta and its accompanying saucepans of tomato and Alfredo sauce. They alone were probably enough to stuff her till she was fit to burst. "All this? Even with my help? I knew you were a big eater, but..." Words failed her.

         "Yup." Ellen, having set the plates, went to get them silverware. "A word of advice: get yourself into the habit of eating all day. Once you're used to that, go back to three meals a day. I guarantee you'll be eating feast's worth for each meal." She set Abagail's silverware. "Plus, each one's gonna get bigger than the last. And if you ever hit my point, you'll go back to snacking between meals, and I'm not talking about a small order of fries."

         It took a moment for Abagail to process what she just heard. Mostly because she found it really hard to drag her attention away from Ellen's body. "So... Wait." She let out a small gasp. "That means you're always hungry and always stuffed at the same time?!"

         "Pretty much." Ellen hung her apron on a hangar next to the oven. "I know it sounds crazy, but... Well, you'll only need to worry about that if you ever reach my size."

         Abagail hummed thoughtfully. It sounded like a lofty goal, but with Ellen's guidance...

         "Well?" Ellen said. She sat right next to Abagail. "Shall we get started?"

         Abagail nodded and bit her lip. So many options, and no idea where to start. Deciding it best to start small, she grabbed three thick slices of garlic bread from the basket next to the broccoli and got to work.

"Heya tubby!" said a cheerful voice.

Nerissa knew exactly who it was without even looking. "Heya skinny." she replied with a grin.

Maya was Nerissa's closest and longest friend, having met in the 1st grade, the two had become fast friends and were lucky enough to go to the same schools as the years went by. She was a rather skinny Jolteon morph who was one of those that no matter what she did, what she ate, or wether or not she exercised, she wouldn't gain weight. The two teased each other about their weight constantly, but in a joking sort of way.

"Alright, what do you want?" Nerissa said, expecting just about anything from her friend.

"I think I may have found you a date..."

At the word "date", Nerissa's mind trailed off into memories of her friend's many previous attempts at matchmaking. The first had been pretty ok, they just weren't each other's type. The second had gotten a little paranoid and possessive, freaking out every time he saw her talking to any guy except him. The third... just too self-centered. The rest all became a blur of breakups and relationships that just fell apart.

"Well?" her friend said, interrupting her little trip down memory lane.
"Oh, ummm, sorry, could you repeat that?" said Nerissa, a little embarrassed at having zoned out.

Danis's jaw nearly dropped. "She's already eaten that much and she's still hungry?!" he thought, then, shaking his head as if to clear his thoughts, said nervously "I.. I'll g..go check in the kitchen, ok?"

"Ok" replied Nerissa, "Hurry back!" As he scurried off to the kitchen, she grinned and patted her belly ,whispering "Ok belly, you asked for it".

Once Danis reached the kitchen he began searching frantically for leftovers of any kind, anything quick and easy to prepare. He found a note on the fridge door that read:

Hey Danis, thought you might need a little something extra, so there’s more in the fridge if you need it. --Vinny

Apparently Vinny’s idea of “a little extra” differed from everyone else’s for when Danis opened the fridge door, he found what looked to be an entire second feast, complete with desserts! But when he picked up the first platter he made an interesting discovery. “This stuff is still warm…” he thought to himself “Vinny must have just finished it all…” Still, no use looking a gift horse in the mouth, as he found Vinny’s trolley and began loading food onto it. Once it was full he wheeled the trolley to the banquet hall, where Nerissa was waiting for him, and the food. She was surprised by the amount of food as he set it down on the table in front of her, another fried chicken, roast turkey, a gigantic bowl of what looked like mashed potatoes and gravy and a basket of biscuits and rolls. Getting over the surprise, she grabbed the nearest thing at hand, the fried chicken. She ate the crispy wings first, enjoying the grease-filled crunch, then moved on to the legs and thighs, after devouring these she moved on to the breast, savoring the rich flavor of the juicy white meat. A minute later and all that was left on the plate was bones as she moved on to the next item, the roast turkey. She ripped off the legs and dunked them in the mashed potatoes and gravy before eating them, delighting in the mixture of spuds and poultry. She finished these quickly and moved on to the rest of the turkey. As she devoured the massive piece of poultry she discovered that there was stuffing in the turkey. Soon that stuffing was in her as she speedily finished off the massive bird, her belly bulging outward to accommodate it. She then proceeded to voraciously devour the biscuits and rolls, dunking each in the potatoes and gravy, her belly bulging out more and more with each and every one. Now she prepared to finish off the potato and gravy mixture, forgoing the use of utensils, she instead opted to guzzle the mixture down like a thick milkshake. Each gulp made her belly bulge further and further out . As she guzzled the starchy mixture, Danis, who had been goggling at her feat of gluttony, had started setting out the dessert, which included not one but two chocolate cakes, a tub of now melted homemade chocolate ice cream, a strawberry cheesecake, and a 2 layer cake that was Vinny’s own invention, it had a chocolate cheesecake layer on the bottom and a regular cake layer on top, all covered in gobs of chocolate frosting. As she finished the last of the potatoes, her belly had bulged out so far that it was touching the table! She backed up from the table a bit, and reached for the nearest thing at hand, the tub of melted ice cream. As she guzzled down the sweet stuff her belly expanded further and further with every gulp, nearly touching the table again when she finished.

“Where is she putting it all?” thought Danis as he watched, shocked at how she could eat so much at one time. Meanwhile, after finishing the ice cream, Nerissa looked at him and, blushing slightly as she spoke, asked,
“Danis, could you do something for me?”

“What?”, asked Danis curiously.

“Could you… feed me?”, Nerissa replied, her face turning crimson as she spoke.

“S..sure”, Danis answered somewhat nervously, and with that he grabbed a butter knife and, slicing up one of the cakes, held a slice up to her lips. She opened her mouth to accept the morsel and Danis stuffed the slice into her mouth, watching as she chewed and swallowed the cake, licking her lips afterward. The rest of dessert was devoured in the same fashion, Nerissa’s belly expanding more and more with every bite. Danis was staggered, simply shocked and amazed at the sheer amount Nerissa had eaten in one sitting. Almost without thinking, he got down on his knees and began massaging her swollen gut with his hands, lovingly caressing the drum-taught skin of her belly. She moans slightly at the soft touch of his hands on the sensitive skin of her tummy, purring all the while. Gradually the pain in her overstuffed belly begins to subside as Danis continues massaging her belly and gradually her moans changed from those of pain to moans of ecstasy. Danis’s hands moved higher and higher until, as if seized by a sudden impulse, he suddenly hugged her tightly and kissed her passionately, stroking her blonde hair all the while. Nerissa’s purring grew louder as he embraced her, and after what seemed an eternity to the two, Danis stopped kissing her, and as he drew his face back, Nerissa licked him on the muzzle. The magic moment seemingly over, Danis’s usual bashful nature took over as he flushed a deep crimson hue and he let go of her, as if embarrassed. A long silence loomed, each one lost in their own thoughts on what had just happened between them. Finally, it was Nerissa that broke the silence, asking, “Danis, would it be ok if I spent the night here? I really don’t think I can get home”, poking her gut and giving a slight grin with that last comment. “S..sure!” replied Danis eagerly, and he blushed again at just how eager he had sounded, “But don’t we need to tell your parents?” “Mmhmm” Nerissa replied, “Just call my dad, he’s a pretty cool dad, I think he’ll understand. But before you do… could you help me get to a bed? I’m kinda sleepy” she said, yawning slightly. “Ok” Danis replied simply.

It took many failed attempts, but finally Danis was able to help Nerissa to her feet, and he began the somewhat arduous task of escorting the overstuffed feline to the nearest bed, which happened to be his. More than once he had to slow down and help her regain her balance as she nearly toppled due to the size and mass of her overstuffed gut, as she wasn’t used to hefting such a large tummy around. Once they reached his room, Nerissa immediately laid down on his bed, dozing off almost instantly. Danis called her dad and told him the gist of what had happened, and got the ok for her to spend the night. And so he returned to his bedroom, gazing lovingly upon Nerissa’s sleeping form, before changing into his pajama shorts and climbing up in bed with her, snuggling up against her soft form, shortly dozing off as well, completely content.

Unbeknownst to the two, the effects of Nerissa’s binge made themselves known overnight, as her body slowly converted all the calories into fat, softening and expanding her form further overnight. When she woke up…

Her belly had always been one of the smaller parts of her rather ample form until now, but now it dominated her overly ample figure, jutting out in front of her and sagging almost to her knees. Her breasts, which had picked up their fair share of fat, sat atop the monument to gluttony that was her belly, having become more of an F cup than the DDs she had had earilier, still maintaining a somewhat globular shape despite their bulk. Her butt had picked up its fair share of adipose as well, resembling two overstuffed couch cushions, her love handles resembled "love waves" more than anything, and her thighs had bulked up to where they were in permanent contact. She ran her hands up and down her fattened form, over every roll on her flabby sides, along the prominent curve of her gargantuan belly, around her massive behind, poking and pinching all over to make sure that this wasn't just a dream. Nerissa thought to herself. It was then that she saw the pile of clothes on the side of the bed Danis had slept on. She picked them up an examined them, they were a rather low cut shirt, ( "All the better to show off my *ahem* "assetts" Nerissa thought to herself, giggling ), and a pair of shiny pants that looked to be made of leather. She looked them over again, they looked large enough, but how could Danis have known...

Putting that thought out of her head, she tried to put the clothes on. The shirt fit ok, showing off her large breasts to great effect and riding up on her belly, exposing a great deal of it. It was another beautiful day in the Hoenn Region. Ash, May, Max and Brock were on thier way to Fortree City. The four are lost in the forest again. They were in a remote section of the forest too. A section that wasn't on the map. It reminded Ash of the Safari Zone back at the Kanto Region. It was the middle of the afternoon.
"My feet are tired" said May. "can't we stop and rest?"
"Now that you mention it, I feel kinda tired myself" said Ash. The group had been walking all day since breakfast, after all.
"That sounds like a good idea" said Brock. "I'll make us all something to eat"
Max, on the other hand, was looking around the forest. Max was idly looking at the ground, when something occured to him. If he looked more closely....
"Guys!" yelled Max. "come here, quick!"
"What is it?" asked May, who came over along with the two others. All four of them stared at what looked like a giant footprint. The footprint was 20 feet across and 7 feet deep!
"What could've made THAT?" asked Ash.
"Not what" said Brock. "WHO!"
Ash looked up to see himself staring at a fleshy wall. He continued to look up until he realized he was looking at a woman's leg!
"Hi there" said a booming voice.
A giant Officer Jenny smiled down at the four tiny people. Officer Jenny was at least 400 feet tall!
"Uh...hello" said Max. He looked like he was going to faint.
"You must be new here" said Officer Jenny. "this is the Giantess Safari Zone, where girls can become a giantess and hunt down little tiny men!"
Officer Jenny pulls out a strange-looking gun and fires it at May. May suddenly grows and grows until she is...
