"I wish I knew!" Sprite stopped growing at about five feet, her fur returning to its usual deep purple. She had grown quite bit. She now came up to his chest, Her fur was also... bushier. Though she was five feet tall her proportion were that of a three year old. She was a bushy toddler!
"Wow this is so cool!! I'm a really big baby now!"
"How'd you that?!" Tad excalaimed.
"I dont know. But what can you do about it! Now lets pway till mommy and daddy get home!!" She said as she hugged you. It was more fun to be hugged by a giant push 3 year old than a small one.
"Alright heres you're bottle." You gave it to her and she started suckong on it. As she sat there Tad couldn't resist but start scaching her between the ears, causing her to relax in her chair. "We'll deal with your size later.
1322.title: Growing Baby

13221.content:
Tad was simply amazed. His baby sister was five feet tall! He could not figure out what caused it. Her clothes, a big blue footed onesie, had grown with her. What would have caused them both to grow?
"I'm done Tad" she had finished her bottle. "I was thinking what if you played with me this time.
"What do you meen? I always play with you."
"No I meen what if you played like a baby this time? You work to hard and never play! You should relax today. Come on we're almost the same size. We could act like we were twins! Please!"
Well she had a point, he was stressed a bit. Sprite alwaysed seem so calm when she acted like a 1 year. "Well...
13221.title: Play With ME

132212.content:
"Ummm... I think I'll pass on that" Tad said, with a note of disdain in his voice.
Sprite frowned.
"But.. uhh we can still play together, right?"
Sprite smiled.
"So wha do we play?"
Tad looked at her and picked up the empty bottle.
"I'll get you another bottle of milk, then we can play hide seek."
"Yay!"
Tad pored out the milk agian, this time giving her a full amount. He brought it back to her and she quickly drank half of it. Quicker than he had ever seen her drink.
(Well she is bigger now....) he thought.
Sprite kept the rest with her and went off to hide.
They played together for while, when during one of Tad's turns to look for Sprite, he notices a flash of light behind the seatee. Then he sees a purple tail rise up, followed by a set of ears, then. He gasped.
"Ohhh i ges u found me agian!" She said, no realising what had happened. She noticed Tad's shocked expression and looked around, then she stepped out and smiled.
"I grew bigger agian!" She cheered, throwing her arms around her "big" brother.
"Yes. Yes you did."
She was now 7ft, and considerbly taller than tad.
"he he guess your not the big brother anymore"
132212.title: Hide and seek

133.author_name: This site is dead.I wana leave
choices: Try to talk to the Eevee
She sees you and says something
133.content:
You are a normal human walking through your city when you hear a loud noise. You think it nothing, until you hear it agian.
You decide to investiage the noise, only to find something that defys belief.
Standing before is a confused and worried Eevee morph. She has long brown hair, and wears simple yet cute looking clothes. Oh, and shes 200 feet tall.
You look in shook.
"Umm hello? Can someone help me please? I have no idea how I got here."
Around you some people are running.
You..
133.title: A strange sight in the city

choices: You stay and talk some more.
You decide to move the conversation somewhere less populated.
The local law enforcement shows up.
1331.content:
You're mesmerized. It's as simple as that. Whether it's because it's so unreal, so bizarre, or because she's so beautif- what? No! She's a Godzilla-sized anthropomorphic Eevee in the middle of a city! You haven't got any clue what's happening! You need to run away fast!

So, naturally, you walk towards her calmly, mouth slightly agape.

When you reach her, she's still trying to convince the fleeing crowds to stay and help.
"Hey, seriously! This is so mean..."
She watches the last citizen in the immediate area run off into an alleyway and sighs heavily. With a pout, she leans against a nearby skyscraper, causing it to bend and creak immediately. She rapidly withdraws with a gasp of "Oops! Sorry!" Sighing again, she lays down and stretches her legs out down the street, resting one hand on her knee and another on a car behind her. With another apology, she shakes the flat husk of metal off and (more carefully) places her fingers on the sidewalk.
"Geez... this sucks. What am I supposed to do now?"

Now that her upper body is closer to the ground, you take a better look at it while paying no heed to the frantic urgings of your mind to make yourself scarce. She looks like she's in her late teens or early twenties, judging by her well-developed body and fresh, youthful appearance. Her hair is long and smooth, plentiful enough to splay out several dozen feet on the ground behind her as she sits. She's already almost crushed a building and actually crushed a car, but her face looks rather intelligent- maybe she's just a little careless? She's probably just not used to this sort of situation, that's all.
Your brain takes this opportunity to remind you that the 'situation' is that she's roughly twenty stories tall. You ignore it again and walk up to her massive sandaled foot. After a brief pause, you poke her furry ankle gently. After a slightly longer pause, you knock on it like you would a door.

That seemed to have gotten her attention, at least. She glanced in your general direction with a confused look, then shrugged and returned to pouting. You quickly knocked again and shouted as loud as you could.
"HELLO?"
The Eevee girl jumped several feet (although that wasn't very much given her size), tossing you to the ground.
"Whoa! Who's there?!"
You gingerly rubbed your backside as you stood up. It was hard to stand with so much wind. Wind?
Turning, you saw her massive face looming feet away, gentle breath flowing over you.
"Oh, hey. Sorry. Didn't mean to... uh... shake you. I just thought everyone had run away already."
Big! Mouth! Jaws! Claws! Danger! Run!
"I think everyone else did, yeah. Don't worry about it."
"Can you believe it? It's obvious I'm in some kind of trouble here, but what happens? Everyone just runs off!"
Upset giant Pokewoman! Escape!

Shaking your head to silence it, you smile and hold out a hand.
"On behalf of the city, I'd like to apologize for the cold reception. I think they were just a bit intimidated, but that's really no excuse."
The Eevee girl extended a huge finger and let her clawtip rest in your palm for a rather bizarre form of handshake.
"Thanks, but what do you mean by intimid- ..." The Eevee looked at you in shock for a moment. "Oooo-h. Oh, wow." She lay her head sideways on the ground and gently rested a finger on your head, evaluating your height. "... Yeeeee-ah. That explains a bit, I think. I guess I must look kinda scary like this." She glanced at her claws with chagrin. You simultaneously noted that each was easily large enough to shred a truck in half, and that each was painted with cute nail polish.
"Er... you hadn't noticed you were so big?"
She ran a hand through her thick brown hair, knocking a few strands over her left eye. "Are you kidding? Of course I did! I just... didn't think I'd be that scary. I figured my natural cuteness would balance out the size." The phrase 'natural cuteness' was accompanied by a kiss blown on her fingertips and a giant wink.
1331.title: Make the first move

choices: "Sure Sam! How about you put me onto your shoulder and we take a walk together!"
"I'd love to, Sam. But didn't you need help with getting yourself home?"
13311.content:
You begin to laugh hysterically at her little "cutesy act", but she gives you a light poke to the stomach to shut you up. What was a light poke to her was enough to knock you onto your rear. She then proceeds to ask you:

"Oh come on... It wasn't that funny, was it?"

You get up and wipe some dirt off of your rump.

"Eh, I guess not... But I really doubt that any level of cuteness could keep people from being afraid of something as big as you!"

"Yeah, I suppose I see where you're coming from... I mean, I just about knocked this building over without even trying to."

She gave the building behind her a light pat with her hand, being exceptionally careful not to use enough force to damage it.

"Hey, I don't think I caught your name... Who are you, anyway?"

"Oh, I'm sorry... I guess that I did forget to introduce myself! My name is Samantha, but you can just call me Sam. Come to think of it, you never said who you are either..."

"Oops! Sorry Sam, I guess I just got hypnotized by your beauty and forgot... My name is Garret, but everyone calls me Gary. Nice to meet you, by the way!"

"Hehehe... Nice to meet you too Gary! So, would you like to do something with me now that we're friends?"



How will you respond?
13311.title: Getting to know the giantess Eevee

choices: continue? ie she picks you up while your reloading your handgun
13313.content:
cas you talk u stop her and hear boots in the distance and yelling? but it does not sound american?

....oh no


you turn around and see this (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RrY-ktQ8I...) [minus the hand to hand alchmeists]

then you turn and say RUN pick me up and run or just run!

you expose a little firearm you were hiding it's a Russian Makarov?(http://www.militarynewsnetwork.com/galle...)

you tell her to run and you hide behind a wall gfiving her a go run and hide motion with ur hands

she refuses and u sigh and as bullets fly strangly all mising her you pop out of cover every now and agian getting off pop shots on the red soldiers as they fire at you with thier AK-47's and Ak-47u's
13313.title: The local law enforcement shows up.

choices: "We need to find out how to get me home, and fast!"
133132.content:
"Hello? Earth-to-Guy, are we clear for descent?" You suddenly snap out of your trance. "Huh, what?" "You were lost in thought for a second there, guy." You shake your head. "I was just thinking about...a possibility." She looks like she was about to ask what you meant when suddenly the sound of sirens fills your eardrums.

Atleast 20 police cars, SWAT trucks, and several helicopters are almost instantly on the scene. The Eevee-girl is now sitting up, dangerously close to you. "What's going on?" she says, with a certain amount of concern in her voice. Suddenly, a voice booms out of a megaphone. "Attention 'Alien.' You have 30 seconds to prove that you're not a threat to us, or we'll open fire." Your eye twitches. Are those guys serious? As if doing something like that could be described as "sane." "W-what?" says the Eevee girl, fear now in her voice. "I-I said I'm not going to hurt you guys!" "15 Seconds!" Your mind races. You're going to have to run sooner or later, lest you get riddled with bullets. "10 Seconds, alien." But you can't just abandon her! She's standing up now, looking like she's about to run. She could easily crush them, but you figure she's far too timid to murder. "5 Seconds!" "4, 3, 2..."

Suddenly, faster then you comprehend, you are grabbed by a large, fluffy hand and your entire world is spinning as she seems to sprint out of the city. The swat care give chase, but her giant feet slam down on the ground, toppling buildings with the sheer destructive weight of the impacts. They're stopped, and the Eevee girl has no difficulty dissapearing into a lush, tall forest.

Your head is spinning. You feel like throwing up, passing out, and screaming all at once. But as soon as it started, it's over, and you feel the tight grip loosen. Your jaw opens wide as you that you landed next to a giant eyeball, with eyelids that could easily throw you far away. "If I lay down on my back, then I'm not visible through the trees. So I thought it'd be a good llace to hide for now." You continue to stare at the eyeball, speechless. "Sorry about treating you so badly during the getaway. You're the only one who unserstands and I...can't lose you yet." You merely nod in understanding. "Why were those guy trying to kill me? I didn't do anything wrong!" "The government here isn't a big fan of aliens, I think. And besides, you're so big you could topple cities by tripping!" You feel the ground under you shift as her gigantic lips curl into a frown. "But that's not fair! I wasn't always this big! I was about as big as you, if I was back home." "Back home?"

She leans up slightly, sending you tumbling down her face until you hit her nose. "Yeah, back home. I'm not from here; I'm from a world where people like me are the norm, and humans are a mere myth." You listen in wonderment and curiousity as she explains the details of her world, that was essentially a version of our world dominated with pokewomen. "So if you're a myth in my world, how do you view me? As a myth?" You think for a moment. "No...we have games about you, I think." Her eyes light up. "Really?!" "Not you specifically, the...Pokepeople. And they're not human shaped, they're more like animals." She frowns. "Oh, dang. So we're not depicted at all like this?" You think about the few times that, yeah, people have drawn them like that, but figure that's worth bringing up later. "Nope."

"So, what do we do now?" you ask her out of curiosity
133132.title: A Dream

choices: ... don't recognize this place at all...
1332.content:
You stand there in shock, not quite sure what to make of the strange sight.
"Hello? Anyone? Please, don't run away..."
The Eevee girl looked at the fleeing crowd before her in desperation. Finally, she saw someone who didn't seem to be running in fear... you!
Cautiously but hastily, she leans down towards you. You can feel her warm breath as she opens her mouth to talk.
"Excuse me, sir- can you help me? I'm not sure what's going on... I..."
1332.title: Looking for answers...

choices: before you can do anything she picks you up
13321.content: "I don't know where I am, or how I got here" You're scared and take a look around, nobody is left. They all ran away so it's just you and the anthro eevee. You turn to try to run "please sir, don't leave me. I'm so scared" You look back to her and she looks like she's about to cry. You summon up some of your courage and walk a tab bit closer to her. She seems to smile at this.
13321.title: ... don't recognize this place at all...

choices: A World Where Pokémorphs Don't Exist, Only Humans
133211.content:
As you move closer to her, you can't help but tremble in fear because of her large size. You barely reach higher than her toes and don't know how she going to react. The slightest movement from her could be the death of you. Since she arrived, you noticed that she hasn't moved so you assume she's being careful but it doesn't make you feel any less worried.

Watching you move towards her, the giant eevee lets out a small smile, but it looks like she's on the verge of crying. You feel reassured by her smile but that feeling only lasted a few moments. You realized that you would not be much help to her. You don't understand why she would need you for anything. She doesn't need protection since everything around her is fragile and weak. The concrete below caved in just from her weight alone. How am I supposed to help a giant creature like her?

Before you could continue your thoughts, she speaks to you, "Thank you for not running away." She whispers trying her best not to scare you. When she speaks, you look up at her, almost craning your neck. "I really don't know what's going or why everything is so small, so please tell me, where am I?
133211.title: You Stay With Her

choices: Eevee Shrinks to a Normal Size
Something Takes Eevee Back Home, With You as Well
1332111.content:
You answer her questioned but all she responded with were confused looks. Whether she knows it or not, she is identical to a fictional character you know very well. You can tell from her features that she is an eevee but not in the way you know them as. Besides the obvious size difference, this eevee is humanoid, or anthro, as opposed to the quadruped from the games. You now notice that she is also very beautiful wearing a simple shirt and shorts which show off her large curvy body. In any case, you know already that she is not from anywhere nearby. Could she have come from another world?

The eevee starts to show more signs of distress as she mutters to herself. "This is not what I wanted to happen. What if I can never return home? What if I'll never see my family again?" Her mind already begins to wander into a dark place and not knowing what else to do, you decided to try and console her the best you could. "Hey!" you shout, grabbing her attention, "l don't know how you got here or what's going on either but um, you don't need to stress out. You are relatively safe here so there is well, nothing for you to worry about and I think you'll eventually find a way home. I'll even stay with you until you do." You fumbled out a string of thoughts not fully believing what you are saying. You are compelled to help this eevee in some way so you tried your best to sound confident.

She responds with a small laugh which you hope is a good sign. "I'm sorry, I don't mean to make you nervous but I promise I won't hurt you. You are right by the way, I just need to stay calm and everything will work out. Being alone is the last thing I want right now so thank you for offering to stay with me." You can't help but smile after she said that. "I mean, I wouldn't want to be alone either if I was in the same situation. I don't know how much help I can be but this is the least I can do."
1332111.title: A World Where Pokémorphs Don't Exist

choices: You Decided to Run Home With Her
13321111.content:
"Oh!" she exclaims. Looking up at her, you notice that she is starting to shrink. Shocked, you ask "Are you alright, what's happening to you?" She calmly explains as she shrinks. "Don't worry, I'm fine, this is good." She lets out a sigh of relief but you're still confused.

She tries her best not to move too much until she is much smaller so that she does not harm you. You notice that clothes she's wearing are shrinking with her. "Could this be normal? Well, at least normal for her." When she felt she was small enough, the eevee stepped out of the two giant paw prints in the street and bends down to meet you eye to eye. "Surprised, huh?" Is that's all she has to say?

She finally reached a height that is about a few inches taller than you. "There, that should be small enough, right?" She's much more cheerful than earlier. "Thank you for your assistance." You don't know how to reply and after a short pause, you decided to ask, "You can control your size?" "For the most part but...," but before she could finish, she gets distracted, you see the eevee's ears twitch. "What is that noise? I think I hear ... sirens? What are they for?"
13321111.title: Eevee Shrinks to a Normal Size

133211111.content:
After you hear her say sirens, you concluded that some authoritative figures were going to arrive. You gasp at the idea of what might happen when they come in contact with your eevee friend. You may have seen too many movies but the thought makes you uneasy. You glance around and see that the area and buildings are still deserted. Without thinking much further, you look at her and say, "We should probably go, follow me." "Huh ... oh, okay."

Someone probably called the police at some point but they played it off as a joke. Of course, when multiple calls of the same anomaly occur, they have to investigate. This would give you enough time to take her anywhere else. The police would be looking for something big as long no one else saw her shrink. You thought it would be best to travel to the park, away from the streets. They'll be looking for something they can see miles away so they'll probably overlook some places on the way.

You stop under a group of trees to catch your breath. "It's this where you wanted to take me?" "No," you reply, "but it's safer than being out in the open while I figure out what to do?" There is no conceivable way for you to send her back where she came from on your own so for now, you just need a place to house her. Taking eevee to your apartment is ideal but... you look her over again and the solution was simple. "We can just cover you up and you'll look normal, mostly."

With nothing around you to use, you decided that your own clothes would have to suffice. Your long pants would cover her legs that her shorts reveal, shoes for her paws, a hoodie to hide her ears and cover her arms and she can use your shirt as a scarf to hide her muzzle.

"We can't do that," she protests. "It would be too cold for you to walk around with so little clothing. You don't even have fur." You insist that you will be fine, "It's the only thing I can think of doing unless you can shrink down small enough to carry you." She shakes her head no so she reluctantly agrees to the plan.

You begin giving her your clothes and she puts on the clothes as you instructed. It seems to work but since she's a little bit bigger than you, the clothes are a tight fit. Her tail is stuffed inside your pants, ears are drooped down under the hood and her large paws stretch your shoes a bit but they hold.

With nothing but an undershirt, boxers, and socks, you say to her, "Looking good," and motion her to follow you. You shiver a little from the short breeze which prompts the eevee to ask if you would be okay again. Her voice is muffled under your shirt but you understood what she said and reply, "I'm fine, it's not that cold and were not too far from where we are going."
133211111.title: Escape Rope

1332111111.content:
When the two of you make it out the other side of the park, you notice that the streets are empty here as well. Most people must be hold up in their homes or trying to get as far away from the city as possible at least that's what you would do. It's too bad you can't explain to people that they have nothing to worry about and that their so-called monster is not very monster like but it was best to take advantage of the confusion. Walking through the empty city is certainly eerie but on the plus side, no one else had to see you half naked. The walk isn't long but was is long enough that Eevee offered to carry you a couple times. She probably wanted to help you stay warm but you declined. You didn't want to burden her.

You make it to your apartment complex and hoped not to run into anyone but of course, "Hey!" You hear a familiar voice, it's your neighbor, Jack. "Didn't you hear what's happening and you just now coming home, don't you have any sense of self-preservation. There's a giant monster loose in the city." You hear him talk in his usual sarcastic tone and he lets out a grand laugh after he finished his statement. "A monster, what are you talking about, did you fall asleep while watching a movie or something." You reply jokingly to help make yourself less suspicious and feel less nervous. "You haven't heard of the rumors going around about some 300, 400-foot dog- creature, it's all over the news." You then hear his wife yell from inside the apartment, "It's true, my friend called and told me what she saw. " Jack looks back into the room, "Then where did it go hun, all they found was broken concrete..." "in the shape of two paw prints, explain that." "Only after you explain where it went." Jack looks back at you, "Listen to her, if it was real, how come there's no video of it. Everyone on the news said their phones didn't work. There was also a blackout in the entire city for the past 30 minutes. That's all way too convenient." You nod in agreement not having anything you wish to add but you assume that what brought eevee here is the cause. Jack adds, "This is some elaborate set-up someone came up with. I wonder how they did it, and why?"

You try to use this moment to say your goodbyes until Jack asks, "Hello, who's your lady friend?" He finally notices her standing behind you and walks toward her. She proceeds to pull the hood lower over her face. "Wait, you don't want to get too close too close to her she's not feeling well." That quick line stopped Jack's advances. "Oh that's too bad, must be because of the weather. Well, you better take good care of... could you tell me your name, miss?" She seemed to be lost in thought until he asked her that. "Eevee," she blurts out without giving it a second thought but only you heard what she said. Jack's responds with "Excuse me?" and not waiting for her to say it again, you interrupt "Eve is her name." "Oh, Okay. It's nice to meet you, Eve, take care now." Taking this chance you drag her away to your door. Before you make it into your apartment you hear Jack again, "And put some clothes on or you'll be the one that's sick." You respond with a quick nod and rush inside.

A sigh of relief escapes your lips after you close the door. "Ah, we can relax now." You look at Eevee and notice she's looking down. "Are you alright?" She removes your shirt covering her face and her hood to look at you, "Thank you, really, thank you for helping me out, you went through so much trouble for me so I'm happy you were there." She continues to shower you with gratitude but you wonder it's necessary. "You heard what people called me right? A monster, that all I've been hearing all the way here." You only remember talking to Jack but realize that her ears are probably pretty sensitive. Everyone in the area is talking about her. "Well I'm not a monster but you were the only one to see that. I was able to shrink because you calmed me down. If I had grown anymore from the stress, I would have been stuck at that size for a while." That must have been what she was trying to tell you earlier. While you were thinking, she comes over any gives you a pretty strong hug. You weren't prepared for the outburst of emotions but you enjoy the warmth from her after being outside in the cold.

She releases after a brief pause and asks you, "What made you approach me anyway? Weren't you scared like the others?" You reply, "Of course I was scared but ... I don't know. A giant eevee isn't something you see every day, or ever. I guess, it was kind of awesome." You ended up blurting out that last part so she replies, "Oh, so you liked that I was a giant. Well then, I guess I'll have to show you more after I have rested." You're baffled by what she said but she just smiles. She lets out a yawn and sits on your couch in the living room.

"Hey, Eve is the name you gave me, right? Well, feel free to call me that, I kind of like it." You agree and she gives you a bright smile. "I'll find a way to repay you for your kindness, okay." You reply,"You don't have to do that but, I would like to ask you something." "I'll tell you anything." Not wanting to waste this opportunity, you speak up, "Well, my biggest question is, how did you get here?"
1332111111.title: You Make it Home

13322.content:
"I just can't seem to stop growing" she said. She then trembled, and grew another 5 ft., causing you to stumble from the surprise. It was then that you realized that her clothes where long gone. You estimated her at around 95ft. tall at this point.

In your mind you weighed your options. You could either try to help her, or run away screaming like the others. While you where thinking the eevee surged another 5 ft., now would be the best time to choose.
13322.title: Ever Growing Eevee

choices: He was moving to this place.
He was here as a tourist.
134.content: John, a 19-year-old charmeleon, shifted his backpack from one shoulder to the other and gave out a rather tremendous yawn, showing off a mouthful of sharp teeth. He'd been walking since four that morning, and just now at noon he was finally at his destination: Ecruteak City. The town had enough history to have its own museum, but that wasn't the reason he was here. John's thoughts were disrupted momentarily as his stomach gurgled, and he blushed as he give his slightly rounded belly a pat as if to reassure it that there were restaraunts ahead. Then he thought of the reason he'd come here...
134.title: John the Charmeleon

choices: John checks out the Burned Tower.
John goes to see the magician!
1342.content:
After a quick but pleasant lunch at a small diner in town, John stood out in the warm day, patting his belly contentedly. "Mmm, that was great. I might have to come back later." His tailfire flickered as he looked around, wondering what to check out first. There was the Burned Tower, which was supposed to be an incredible sight to behold. Also, many treasure hunters came into town every now and then to scavenge around the ruins, so maybe he could find a cool souvenir.

However, there was also a magician in town, and his act was supposed to be legendary! Who knew what kind of tricks he'd pull off?

Or he could keep looking and see what else was up.
1342.title: He was here as a tourist.

135.content:
I'll offer a couple of options and then open the third choice for people to post more.

Jasper, an adventure-eager 16-year-old Pikachu, has spent most of his life cooped up in Pallet Town. As he steps out on the journey that will turn him from a boy into a man, what event will drastically change the way he sees life? Will he perhaps grow even more than intended, or will the world around him become even bigger and more daring?

!+!

Parker is a 20-year-old Grovyle who's fed up with the simple life of living in Littleroot Town. His heart throbs for excitement, and he wants to make memories that'll last a lifetime across the cities of Hoenn. Will his eager appetite make him the giant Hoenn's never seen, or will he suddenly become tiny and find a lot more excitement than he'd ever expected?
135.title: More Choices for Macros and Micros

1353.content:
Since I've not seen options for these, I'll bring in a Pokemorph that represents the Unova region and one for the Kalos region. Because that's over 200 more morphs to potentially make big or small, so why not help them get a foot in the door?

Katie is a 22 year old Sylveon living in Kalos. She's the youngest of six siblings, and tied for the tallest with her oldest sibling Shadow and her father Walter (an Umbreon and Vaporeon respectively) at 6'1". Her two sisters, Winter and Cindy, (a Glaceon and Flareon respectively) are a tad jealous of her figure and ability to practically eat like a Snorlax, but they still get along fine. Perhaps she will experience some big changes, either to herself or the world around her? And maybe she won't be the only one?

Annabelle is a caring young Leavanny. The 21 year old has high hopes for breaking into the fashion industry in Castellia City as either a designer or model...but hasn't had any success yet. Will she hit it in a big way that few would ever expect, or will the currently 5'4" girl find herself coming up short to her advantage?

And yes, other options can be available.
1353.title: Katie and Annabelle!

13533.content: Well if you can't pick out any of these other protagonists for the story to be about, then maybe you'd like to be the main character. You're a pokemorph out exploring the world! Will you become as tall as buildings, or so small you can't even see over a blade of grass? It's your adventure to be had!
13533.title: What about you

135331.content:
A pleasure to meet you! You'll be the protagonist of the story and we'll follow along on your adventures!

Oh right before we continue I should introduce myself.

A leafeon woman wearing a white lab coat appears in front of you.

"I'm Professor Maple. I'm here to welcome you as you begin your journey in our world. I'm a professor who studies pokemon and their relations to humans. Surprised by my appearance? I'm neither a human or a pokemon, or it might be more accurate to say I'm a little bit of both. I'm what we call a pokemorph. We look like humanoid versions of pokemon, but can talk. Some of us can even use pokemon moves like actual pokemon. Our little region of the world has a lot of us, we've been around for as long as our written history. Exploring how pokemorphs came around is a huge part of my research, maybe some day in the future you'll be a big help to it. It's a quite interesting subject really, do pokemorphs come from altered pokemon, or altered humans, or a bit of both? Is there perhaps a point where pokemon and humans weren't so different in the past? Not to mention, there's always records of people who weren't always pokemorphs but have somehow through science or magic been transformed into one. I apologize, I get a bit distracted, that's enough about me for a bit. This is your journey, if you choose to help me on my research I'd be thrilled, but this is all about you."

The professor blinks.

"Oh my, and I haven't even gotten a good look at you. Explaining about pokemorphs without even knowing who or what you are. So tell me, are you a human or a pokemorph?"
135331.title: Yes I'm the main character!

choices: I'm a human who got turned into a Pokemorph!
1353312.content:
"Another pokemorph oh my!" Professor Maple blinks. "Forgive my rambling explanation you probably already know a bit about where we came from and our history, I bet you're curious how are kind first originated as well too. I do hope you'll consider helping with my research. Oh, wait am I jumping to conclusions."

She looked you up and down.

"You do hear strange stories after all, things that seem to define rational explanations. I just have to ask. Have you always been a pokemorph, or are you a human who somehow was transformed?"
1353312.title: A Pokemorph

13533122.content:
"You used to be human?" Professor Maple sounded amazed. "This could mean so much to my research! And well! I suppose that might be a little insensitive to your situation. I don't know how you feel about being changed into a radically different species, but you shouldn't let it bother you to much. We're in a world where everything changes if you think about it. Pokemon can evolve into new beings, perhaps becoming pokemorphs is just another form of evolution. Don't ever let yourself feel like a freak this world is full of creatures of all shapes and sizes. Sometimes you'll come up to them small sometimes you might feel like you tower over the. The important thing to remember about is that you're still you, and you can choose how you want to act and who you want to be"

The leafeon girl gave a polite bow.

"Well I think I've taken up enough of your time. I hope you come to visit me someday I feel my research could benefit a lot from meeting you. But now it's time for your journey to begin. I think, the best day to start with, would be the day you changed. The day you blurred the line between pokemon and human."

You adventure starts on the day you were transformed into a pokemorph.

It all started with...
13533122.title: I'm a human who got turned into a Pokemorph!

choices: You volunteered to undergo a transformation
You were kidnapped by a nefarious team
135331222.content:
Was it the day you lost your humanity.

Or the day you gained something more.

"Vital signs are stable. Physical changes are complete." A female voice spoke.

Your head throbbed. You couldn't remember the last time you had a headache this bad. Actually you weren't sure your head had ever hurt this bad, and you felt, some kind of tingling and everything felt.. fuzzy. You just wanted to go to sleep, but people were talking? Who were they, you couldn't think.Couldn't remember. If they weren't going to shut up you didn't have any choice, you were going to have to wake up. You tried to open your eyes.

"Subject is conscious." The voice spoke up.

You managed to open your eyes. Everything looked blurry. It took you a moment to realize why. You were underwater. Wait? Was it water. No, some kind of brightly colored green liquid surrounded you. You weren't sure how but you were breathing fine while in it. You felt your heart accelerating as you tried to process what was going on, tried to remember how yo had gotten here.

"Subject heart rate has accelerated. They're aware. Shall we drain the tank?" The female voice spoke.

You tried to remember how you had gotten here and what was going on. Who were these people, why were you here?
135331222.title: The Power of Science

1353312221.content: You somehow remember that this team was asking for volunteers for testing a formula to transform humans into pokemorphs. You remember that you had to be knocked out first. Although before that, they asked which pokemorph you wanted to be, but it had to be a fire, water, or grass type. You remember it was....
1353312221.title: You volunteered to undergo a transformation

choices: It was covered in blue fur with a yellow band
It looked like a different type of pokemon paw
1353312222.content:
Yes you remembered now. You bad been on the outskirts of your town, you had been considering leaving for a journey because you felt your life needed a change. It was one of those be careful what you wished for scenarios. You hadn't even seen the person who had done it, they had hit you on the back of the head and you were out like a light. Next thing you knew you had woken up here feeling all weird.

"Not yet." It was another voice that spoke up this time, a male voice. "Let's ensure they're not to awake yet. We don't know what abilities will manifest. We wouldn't want our subject to become violent and lash out at us." The voice sounded smug and full of itself. You already hated whoever it belonged too.

You tried to look around and see who was talking about you in the room. You could just barely see through the liquid everything was in a haze. You were in some kind of glass tube filled with the green liquid. You slowly reached out a hand to touch the inside of the glass tube, and then for a brief moment you forgot your concern about the other people in the room. Your hand, it was wrong.

It didn't look like your normal hand instead...
1353312222.title: You were kidnapped by a nefarious team

choices: You left your cell to look for a way out
You waited in your cell to see if anyone would show up
13533122221.content:
You opened your mouth and gasped as you saw your hand. You also become very thankful that whatever this green liquid was that it was apparently impossible to drown in it. Your hand looked a bit like a paw and was covered in light blue fur, then there was a band of yellow around your wrist. You twisted inside your tube trying to look at yourself. It wasn't just your hand that was different. The light blue fur covered both your hands and arms, as well as your chest and stomach. Looking down at yourself you saw that at your waistline the fur became a much darker navy blue. It went all the way down to your feet, which now looked like an animal's paws instead of your normal feet. Then, you had something new attached to you, a new part of you. You could control it but it took a few moments for you to realize what it was.

You had a tail! It has the same dark blue fur as your lower body, though the tip of it seemed to have an almost star shaped bit that was colored in the same yellow as the stripes on your wrists. You wondered what else was different that you couldn't see. You reached up one of your hands and felt around your face. The front of it pushed out in what you assumed was a muzzle, and reaching a hand inside your mouth you felt sharp pointy fangs inside.

You reached a hand up to the top of your head, and you felt large round ears on the top of your head.

"Well looks like the subject is aware of the change." The smug male voice spoke.

"Shinx Transformation is stable." The female voice spoke. "He will survive, the process is complete."

"Excellent. I want more subjects to perform tests on, after we're sure we've perfected the method we'll start on something a bit more intimidating."

You didn't understand, but you got enough to know these people were up to no good, and they had used you. Righteous anger filled you, then electricity started to spark around the bands on your wrist. You opened your mouth and let out a roar that was muted by the liquid as you started to generate more electricity in an attempt to blast your way out.

"Well, looks like we have a feisty one." The smug voice spoke. "Apply a sedative before that thing wrecks the lab. Then apply the safeguard and drain the tank."

You didn't hear anything else said after that, it as at this point that you blacked out.

...

...

...

Who knows how much time passed before you woke up again. This time you were no longer suspended in a tube of liquid but instead were laying on a moth eaten cot inside a small cell. You were now dressed in a pair of threadbare shorts and sleeveless shirt. They didn't do much to offer any form of protection, but now that you were covered in fur you weren't about to freeze to death. Still they were a little big on you, the shirt barely hang on to your shoulders and if you didn't have a tail poking through a hole in them the shorts likely would not have stayed on at all.

You sat up on your cot and threw your legs over the end. You noticed that the cot was so high up your feet didn't actually touch the ground. It was weird actually. The cell and the cot all looked kind of big, like they were made for some kind of giant three times your size. You wouldn't have thought that a prisoner (which is what you assumed you were) would warrant such spacious living arrangements.

You slid off the cot and landed on the floor. Standing felt a bit weird, in that you found yourself naturally standing on the tips of your toes instead of flat on your feet. You swished your new tail as you looked around. Everything about this new shinxlike body was strange, and you weren't sure what to react. Right now you were more concerned with who had kidnapped you, and why they had changed you. You walked over to the door. There was no handle or knob on your end, but you could see one on the other side of the door. The handle was well above your head though, once more as if it had been designed for someone much taller than you...

You examined the cot and room again, and then the door, and you had a realization. This was not a large cell. Apparently, when you had been transformed into a human shinx hybrid you had become much, much shorter than you started. You were probably only about two feet tall now if you had to guess based on how much bigger the door was than you.

Your hear started to beat faster as you thought about how much bigger any guards around this place would be. You grabbed onto the bars of your cell door to steady yourself as you felt dizzy thinking about it.

And the door opened...

The door wasn't locked, it hadn't even been shut all the way. You poked your head out the open door and looked outside. It was a hallway lined with similar doors on either side. You didn't see any guards, or really any signs of life at all the place was completely abandoned. Somehow, the complete lack of any readily apparent adversary bothered you more than anything else.

You weren't sure what was going on, but you had to get out of here. Still was it safe, you had no idea what kind of dangers were around, who had kidnapped you, and what they would do if they found you out of your cell.

You took a deep breath and made a decision.
13533122221.title: A Shinx Morph, and not a big one

135331222211.content:
Whatever was going on, you weren't going to stay here. You had no idea what this place was or who the people that had brought you here and changed you were, but you weren't going to stick around here to let them do whatever they were up to. You stepped out of the cell, your tail swishing against your leg as you looked around to see where you were. You were in a long hallway filled with cell doors similar to your own. You walked down to the next cell and looked into it to see if there was anyone there. You couldn't see anyone. You were able to see claw marks all over the wall in the cell though, though there was something strange about them.

There were several sets of claw marks on the wall, and they were all at different heights. There were large claw marks about four feet off the ground in the cell. Higher up than you, then there were slightly smaller claw marks about two feet off the ground, and even smaller claw marks only a foot off the ground level with you. Peering into the cell you could see another set of much smaller marks only a few inches off the ground. You wondered if there had been multiple people or pokemon inside the cell. You looked at the cell, there was one bed, though it had been ripped apart and thrown on its side. If there were multiple people in here at once it wasn't comfortable. Maybe the cell had just seem a lot of use.

You moved on. There were a huge number of cells in this area, and though none of them were currently occupied they all showed similar signs of wear and tear to indicate they had been in use. You wondered how many of these people had been experimented on like you.

Eventually you reached the end of the hall. There was a large metal door that marked the exit to the hallway. It was probably some kind of security door, and you could see a card reader on the wall above you. Lucky for you the door was ajar, so someone wasn't very good at security.

Right the people who managed to kidnap you and who knows how many others and and with technology far beyond anything else available were probably just incompetent and left the door open. You tried to reassure yourself of this but it did no good. By this point you had figured out that something had gone down here, but you didn't know what.

You slipped through the open door. It took you onto a metal platform slightly raised off the ground. There was a sign posted on the wall. You couldn't see it at your height very easily. You had to jump up and down to read it. It was at this point that you learned despite your small stature you felt much stronger than you did as a human. You easily leaped straight up five feet into the air and it was as easy as a little hop. Like this you were able to read the sign on the wall.

It was giving directions.

Left: Control Room
Right: Training Plaza

To bad neither of them was marked as an exit. You thought for a moment about which direction you should go.
135331222211.title: You left your cell to look for a way out

choices: Eric gets out of the room
143.content:
Darkness.
That's what Eric Lester remembers. It's the only thing he remembers. He has no prior memories before the darkness. He has no idea where he is or what he was doing. His world was darkness. A few images came to him, as if from a dream. He saw many things, none of which made any sense to him. The images were blurry and unfocused.
"Wake up, Eric"
The voice was female. It echoed through the darkness. Eric managed to open one eye and the other quickly followed. He was in a room of some sort. The room looked to be a lab of some sort. He was lying on a table with restraints off of him. Eric quickly got up from the table and stood unsteadily on the floor.
"Good. Very good"
The female voice again. The voice came from nowhere. Eric was puzzled, until he realized that the voice had came from *inside* his head. Was he going crazy?
"Get out of that room"
Eric noticed the door to the room was opened. So, he walked over to the door. That's when Eric passed by a mirror. He peered into the mirror and saw something that made him scream. He was no longer human! He was a pokemon! A Scyther to be exact, complete with wings.
"What the--?" asked Eric aloud. His voice was high-pitched like a Scyther's. But he spoke human language. When did this happened? How did this happened? A human can't become a pokemon! What was going on?
"Eric, just relax and do as I say"
"Where are you?!" asked Eric, whirring around but saw nobody.
"I'm outside. Come outside"
143.title: Rebirth

1432.content:
As eric turned to walk out of the room a woman appeared in the doorway. She was of average height and wore a white labcoat. Her long auburn hair reached to her shoulders where it curled up. Her blue eyes met Eric's and she gazed at him from behind her glasses. Eric noticed on her arm was a red band with a white 'R' on it.

"I see you've awakened Eric," the mystery woman said, "My name is Dr. Veronica, I'm a scientist here working on genetic research."

"Why am I like this? What happened" Eric said cocked his green head sideways.

"You were involved in an experiment," She said, "I cant get into further details now, because I'm here to...."
1432.title: Mystery Woman

14322.content:
"Do not trust this woman"
The voice didn't came from Dr. Veronica.
"Come on" said Dr. Veronica. "we have to finish the experiment"
"Get away" said the voice in Eric's head.
Two men entered the room then. The two men were 6 feet tall and wearing body armor. Ihe men looked like SWAT police, Eric mused. SWAT? Wait. How could he remember what SWAT police look like?
"Be gentle to him" said Dr. Veronica to the two men.
Eric backed up and took off into the air! He flew past the three startled people and zipped headlong into the wall of the hallway. Dazed for the moment, Eric saw Dr. Veronica got something out of the pockets of her lab coat. Eric quickly got up from the floor and ran down the hallway.
"Get him!" yelled Dr. Veronica, and the two SWAT police began to chase Eric down the hall. A clawed hand touched Dr. Veronica on the shoulder.
"You should go to, Wesson" said Dr. Veronica to the hulking form behind her.


Eric was lost. He was inside what looked to be a hospital. He had lost the two SWAT police, and making his way down a hallway that led to a lobby. The lobby was empty. Eric dashed out of the doors and into the cool night. It took a few minutes for his eyes to adjust to the darkness. Eric was flying away in the air. Soon, he saw a city below.

As he walked down the street he turned and saw his reflection in the mirror and was startled by it for a second. "Oh crap, I'm a scyther, how am I supposed to get help from people, just ask them?" He asked himself,"Who's going to take time to listen to a talking bug."

As he was musing about his situation his acute hearing picked up a noise, it was foot steps, and they were coming closer to him.

He was about to take off and fly away when.

The trainer threw the ball at Eric. Eric didn't know if it was possible for him to be captured by a pokeball, but didn't want to find out. Eric made a run for it. Actually, Eric flew away from the trainer. The trainer threw another pokeball, and a Charmander came out.
'Oh great' thought Eric.
"Charmander, ember!" ordered the trainer.
"Yes, master" said the Charmander. Eric's eyes went wide. He could understand what the Charmander said. Was it because he was a pokemon now? Eric dodged the attack and continued to fly off.
"Come back here!" yelled the trainer. Eric didn't listen to the trainer, as he flew off. Soon enough, Eric was out of the city and landed in the forest.
"Good" said the voice in his head. "now continue to come this way and you'll come to a small lake"
Eric walked through the forest. When he came to a river, Eric looked at his reflection. What had caused him to look like this? Eric never heard of a person becoming a pokemon before. Eric followed the river for half a mile when the river went into a lake. The lake was perhaps 2 miles long, and half a mile wide. There, in the middle of the lake, was a Lapras.
"Hi" said the voice in Eric's head.
"Um.." said Eric, looking around.
The voice giggled. "I'm the Lapras, silly. I told you I was like you. I used to be a person too"
"With Psychic powers?" asked Eric. People with psychic powers were rare, but Eric had heard about him.
"Actually, no" said the Lapras in his head. "my psychic powers came with this new body of mine. The name's Sally"
"My name is Eric" said Eric. "how did this happen to me?"
"Lost your memory I see" said Sally.
"Some of it" said Eric. "I remember my name, but not much else. Why did you call for me here?"
"Team Rocket has been doing experiments like this for quite a while" said Sally. "turning people into pokemon. Actually, they're making hybrids; People with pokemon attacks. Sometimes, it doesn't work as good as they want it to be"
"So that's what happened to me?" asked Eric.
"Yes" said Sally.
"Any way to reverse it?" asked Eric.
"Professor Maple is working on a cure" said Sally. "she's a hybrid. Cross betweem a charizard and a human. She got away from Team Rocket and vows to find a cure for our kind"
"How many of us are there?" asked Eric.
"Around 1,500" said Sally.
"Wow" said Eric.
"We all live in a village not far from here" said Sally. "follow me"


Sally led Eric to a small village. People came out to greet Sally and Eric. All of the people in the village were either a pokemon or a hybrid of human and pokemon. One kid around Eric's age was a hybrid of a snorlax. Another was a hybrid of a Zapdos and a human. Professor Maple was indeed a hybrid of a charizard. Professor Maple had the head of a 30ish woman with glasses, and the body of a charziard. Her hair was orange-red with black red at the bangs. She had a right hand of a human and a left hand of a charizard.

As Eric walked and met some of the others, he noticed one thing. He was one of a kind. Everyone else were only parts of pokemon, not complete ones like him. He felt alone. Like an outsider. He walked just beyond the village and into a small clearing in the surrounding forest. There was an Alakazam morph (his head, both hands and feet were alakazam, the rest human) in a meditation position, floating 3 feet off the ground, just floating there, wearing a blind fold and a martial arts robe. He didn't notice Eric untill he stood on a twig and it snaped. Suddenly, the Alakazam was alert and seemingly hostile. "Who's there?" it said in a raspy tone.
"Eric" He replied, feeling a slight itching feeling on the back of his head. He didn't scratch it. The Alakazam growled back "Good, now that we've been introduced, tell me how you are stopping me from reading your mind." Eric scratched the back of his head.
"Because, there's nothing there to read?" Eric guessed.
"New, eh?" he replied via telekinesis. "Ah... better. So, I am only able to communicate with you by telekinesis, but I can't read your mind. Interesting... And I'll have you know, boy, that every mind has something there, even if the mind in question has any type of memery loss."
"Sooo, you can't help me unlock any memories?" asked Eric.
"No, that is something we must all do by ourselves. Psychics will only reveal so much, no matter what they see inside other's minds." it quickly replied.
Eric gave him a wondering look, and asked, "Arn't you going to take the blind fold off and realize that I look like a complete Scyther?"
"No. Taking the blind fold off would only scar you for life. My eyes were gouged out, by who, I don't know. It was, I was told by Rocket scientists, a side effect of the morphing. Doubtful as it is, I don't need them. I can sense everyone from here to a nearby city where a disturbance has upset the personel at a Rocket lab. I was originaly a psycic as a human and becoming a Alakazam morph only strengthened my psycic abilities to the point where, on human standards, I had mastered them. I have since moved my training to martial arts and meditation." He said, occasionaly turning his head this way and that. "But enough about me. Let's here about you."
"Me?" Eric asked, and indicated towards himself. "Well... I'm Eric, == years old, recently escaped from a Team Rocket 'hospital', escaped a trainer who wanted to catch me, was contated psycicly by Sally through the whole thing, and now I'm here, waiting for a cure. Untill then, I look compleatly like a Syther. There's not much more I remember, nothing of it is my past life."
He chuckled a little " And here is the boy Syther who was saying there was nothing to be read from his mind." He shook his head in amazement. "The hour must be getting late, you best be off to see Professor Maple. Unless you wish to train agianst me?"

"Village is up there," Sally motioned with her head, "I'm a little restricted to water only travel on this river, so you need to go on alone, Professor Maple works out of a cave at the base of the mountain the village is by, just tell her 'Sally sent you'"

The village wasn't more than a quick hike from the river, it was mostly shanty buildings, a few tents, or burrows dug by some of the morphs.

The morphs varied widely in type and species, some were, like Eric, now full pokemon, some were a hodge-podge of pokemon and human parts, like Professor Maple, and a few were full anthros.

The professors cave wasn't hard to find, it was a large opening in the rock that looked like it went back a ways, a small beat up looking generator with a volt orb hooked up to it hummed outside and provided electricity to the lit interior.

"Hello?" Eric shouted, "Professor Maple? I'm a new comer, Sally sent me!" He shouted deeper into the cave.

"Ill be right with you!" A voice shouted back. The professor emerged shortly afterwords from around a corner. 143221122.title: The Professor

1432211221.content:
The Cave in which Professor Maple now lived had many rooms. Rooms made by Onix-morphs mostly, which ate rocks as food. Professor Maple showed Eric to a medium-sized room with lights, a phone, etc. There was even a kitchenette with a fridge.
"Make yourself at home" said Professor Maple. "forgive me, but there are things I must attend to"
Professor Maple left the room.
Eric turned on the TV. The TV only had 60 or so channels. He flipped it to the local news.
"This is Al Seymour here at the Mount Sanguine Research Center" said a human on the news. "hours ago, an explosion rocked the center after someone was reported to have escaped. This is Professor James Mackwell, head of research here at the research center--"
Professor Mackwell looked vaguely familar to Eric. Eric was sure he hadn't seen Mackwell before in his life, but the professor did seem familiar. Perhaps Eric had seen him on TV a long time ago.
"We wish to ensure the people of Sanguine City that they are no danger" said Professor Mackwell. "the explosion was caused by an accident within the main lab. And as for someone escaping the center, I have no idea what was that about. We hold no prisoners in the center--"
"That's a lie" said Sally's voice in Eric's head. "that research center has been doing the same thing to people; making them into hybrids"
"And the 'accident' ?" asked Eric.
"No doubt caused by The Outcasts" said Sally.
"Who are they?" asked Eric.
"The Outcasts are a group of people like us. The difference between our two groups is that we have accepted what has happen to us and are ready to wait for Professor Maple to come up with a cure" said Sally. "The Outcasts are people that hate what has happened to them, and vow to kill the ones who did that to 'em. My sister, Ann, is a member of The Outcasts. The Outcasts beileve that there is no cure for our kind"
"I think I agree on that point" said Eric, looking at his own sword-like claws.
"Professor Maple is close to finding a cure" said Sally. "It's only a matter of time"
Eric turned the TV off.
"Right now, I feel like I can sleep for 1,000 years" said Eric, who fell to the bed and fell asleep almost instantly. He couldn't hear that Sally was giggling.
1432211221.title: The Outcasts

14322112211.content:
Eric was awakened by the sound of footfalls coming down the hallway. He instinctively jumped into a defensive posture, but his stance changed when he saw the professor at his doorway.

"Im sorry if I startled you," She said, "Please follow me, Id like to give you a quick exam, then you can ask me any questions you'd like."

She exited the room, with Eric in tow, she lead him to a room with various scientific and medical equipment. "Im just going to do a quick physical," She said.

After the exam was over, she stood studying her notes. "Hmmm....interesting," She mused.

"What is it," Eric asked.

"Well, you appear to have been changed differently than the others," She explained, "Ill have to study the DNA sample and these notes more carefully, but you might be the key to finding a reversal formula."

"What do you mean 'changed differently'?" Eric asked, "You weren't all morphed the same?"

"No, and thats what makes creating a cure so hard," Maple said, "You see how I'm a mismatch of charizard and human?"

"Yea"

"Well, thats because I was morphed with the original formula, it created mis-matched morphs, which is not what the Rockets wanted, the second batch are the ones that are complete pokemon. They are closer to what they wanted, a weapon with the intelligence of a person, and the powers of a pokemon, but this tended to wipe their memories, which made them no better than a pokemon they could catch in the wild. Some would recover memories, or fragments later, but never completely. The latest batch are the full anthros, half pokemon and half human through and through. They are close to being what the rockets are trying to make, but still retain some pokemon appearance," She explained, "I wonder why they would go back to using the old formula, unless you are something special."

"I see," Eric said, "So what can I do to help?"

"Nothing now," I have to analyze this, "Why don't you go see the town"

Fireball looked like a normal charizard, but with blond hair and a human right leg and foot.

The other two kids who were under 20 were named 'Kidtaur' (who was a Ponyta morph) and 'Casper' (a ghost morph)
Some of the morphs had regular pokemon with them, for some of the morphs had been trainer before they were changed. All of the morphs could understand what regular pokemon were saying.
Professor Maple spent half the day in her lab, and came out just after 12:00 noon.
"You have some of your human DNA left" said Maple. "much more human DNA than any other person in this town"
"So I'm more human than pokemon?" asked Eric.
Professor Maple shook her head.
"You're a pokemon through and through" said Maple. "but with more human DNA than even myself"
"Then, why aren't I a morph like the others?" asked Eric.
"I don't know" said Professor Maple. "but I do have a theory...."
"Humans are approaching" came the voice of Sally in everybody's head. "pokemon trainers, by the looks of them"
"How many?" asked Professor Maple.
"Four" said Sally. "they're half a mile away to the South"
"Let's go and greet them" said Fireball. "few humans ever come here because they're afraid of us"
"Yes, go and greet 'em" said Professor Maple. "but don't harm them"
"We won't" said Fireball.
Fireball, Sparky, Kidtar, Casper and you decide to greet the four humans. You have decided to call yourself 'Cutter'.

Eric panicked and dived into an alley. There, he hid behind a Dumpster. The person that made the footsteps passed the alley. Actually, it was several people passing the alley. Eric peeked over the Dumpster to look at the people that walked passed the alley. At the lead was a small boy in a red-and-white hat. A Pikachu was riding on the boy's shoulder. The second person was a girl with brown hair. The third person was an even smaller boy with glasses. The fourth and last person was a teenager with his eyes closed.
"I thought you said this was a shortcut to Fortree City" said Red Hat.
"It is!" said Glasses. "Fortree City is close to this city!"
The rest of the converseation faded as the people walked away from the alley. Eric got up from his hiding place and looked to see if the coast was clear. It was. He stepped out of the alley and wondered what to do next.
"Go to Fortree City" said the voice in his head.
"Who are you?" asked Eric aloud quietly.
"A person like you" replied the voice. "a person that has been changed..."
"Fortree City is five miles away" said Eric. "how can you talk to me all the way from there?"
"I'm psychic" said the voice. "the name is Sally. I'll contact you when you're in Fortree City"
Eric looked in the direction of where that small group was going. They were going to Fortree City. Why not follow those kids?
